[{'created': '2018-02-12 20:28:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use correct requirements branch for tags

When translating our release artifact jobs to Zuul v3, we missed the
bit from I806062dd24f9dbd2b98cafd32c08bb524e73c5ac where we used to
guess the matching branch for a given tag so we could apply the
correct version of the upper-constraints.txt file for stable point
releases. Add that back in so we stop building stable release
tarballs using master constraints.

Change-Id: I744d6db4a2f98647d071f7f3660dfa764ec046fc
'}, {'created': '2018-02-12 20:32:58.000000000', 'message': 'Use correct requirements branch for tags

When translating our release artifact jobs to Zuul v3, we missed the
bit from I806062dd24f9dbd2b98cafd32c08bb524e73c5ac where we used to
guess the matching branch for a given tag so we could apply the
correct version of the upper-constraints.txt file for stable point

tarballs using master constraints.

Change-Id: I744d6db4a2f98647d071f7f3660dfa764ec046fc
'}]
commit_message:
Use correct requirements branch for tags

When translating our release artifact jobs to Zuul v3, we missed the
bit from I806062dd24f9dbd2b98cafd32c08bb524e73c5ac where we used to
guess the matching branch for a given tag so we could apply the
correct version of the upper-constraints.txt file for stable point
releases. Add that back in so we stop building stable release
tarballs using master constraints.

Change-Id: I744d6db4a2f98647d071f7f3660dfa764ec046fc

subject: Only set switch_id in local_link_connection if it is a mac address
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

A few minor things inline + please create a release note, especially if you do plan on backporting it to Pike'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:29:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:36:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

So I think recording whatever the switch reports is the correct behavior. I think instead, we might need to address the fact that ironic is trying to fit all LLDP data into a box that is not really correct. I'm sure from a neutron perspective it makes sense, but as I understand it, it is just passed to the ML2 driver and may not be actually used. Having the correct data to be correlated back for an ML2 driver to use seems to make the most sense to me."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:58:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The contract Ironic set up between ironic and the ml2 drivers is that the switch id is a mac address or openflow datapath ID. The switch_id although we can populate it using the data from chassis id, it wasn't designed to exactly match chassis ID.

Setting it to anything else may resulting in some ML2 drivers breaking, although from my experience most switches will transmit multiple chassis id entries, where one might be a name and one will be the mac address, so from my perspective to maintain our contract we should grab the mac address one for the LLC switch_id and drop the others.

However, personally I think we need to have a discussion about the LLC data format anyway. I don't think the current design fits all use cases very well, for example our Cisco nexus ml2 driver completely ignores the switch_id field because our ml2 driver doesn't care about that, and we put the switch's management IP address in the switch_info field instead which the ml2 driver uses to identify the switch."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:30:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

In that case, I think it is fine for us to move forward with this, but I believe we should amend the contract with the ml2 drivers which should offer greater flexibility and ultimately possibly reduce operator headaches. As is, I think a switch id will still be expected, but I'm all for revising."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I think this change is a good short-term fix, especially since changing the validation of switch_id will require a microversion. Bob, could you please clean up the release note a bit - see inline?'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-02-09 14:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-02-09 14:35:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck bug 1748892'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-12 16:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck POST_FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

The release note needs a bit more fixing, otherwise looks good'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Fixed the release note, LGTM now.'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-02-13 13:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-13 13:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 14:27:45.000000000', 'message': 'Only set switch_id in local_link_connection if mac address

When the processed lldp data is used for setting the local_link_connection
switch_id, it will set it even if the Chassis ID is not a mac.  Need to
only set it when the ChassisId is a mac address, as is done when using
non-processed lldp data.

This fixes a regresssion introduced in Pike.

Change-Id: I566acb5b19852b541df7554870ab2666f7df9614
Closes-Bug: 1748022
'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 15:29:52.000000000', 'message': 'Only set switch_id in local_link_connection if it is a mac address

When the processed lldp data is used for setting the local_link_connection
switch_id, it will set it even if the Chassis ID is not a mac.  Need to
only set it when the ChassisId is a mac address, as is done when using
non-processed lldp data.  Ironic validates that switch_id is either a
mac address or OpenFlow datapath ID.

This fixes a regresssion introduced in Pike.

Change-Id: I566acb5b19852b541df7554870ab2666f7df9614
Closes-Bug: 1748022
'}, {'created': '2018-02-09 14:33:24.000000000', 'message': 'Only set switch_id in local_link_connection if it is a mac address

When the processed lldp data is used for setting the local_link_connection
switch_id, it will set it even if the Chassis ID is not a mac.  Need to
only set it when the ChassisId is a mac address, as is done when using
non-processed lldp data.  Ironic validates that switch_id is either a
mac address or OpenFlow datapath ID.

This fixes a regresssion introduced in Pike.

Change-Id: I566acb5b19852b541df7554870ab2666f7df9614
Closes-Bug: 1748022
'}, {'created': '2018-02-13 09:34:05.000000000', 'message': 'Only set switch_id in local_link_connection if it is a mac address

When the processed lldp data is used for setting the local_link_connection
switch_id, it will set it even if the Chassis ID is not a mac.  Need to
only set it when the ChassisId is a mac address, as is done when using
non-processed lldp data.  Ironic validates that switch_id is either a
mac address or OpenFlow datapath ID.

This fixes a regresssion introduced in Pike.

Change-Id: I566acb5b19852b541df7554870ab2666f7df9614
Closes-Bug: 1748022
'}]
commit_message:
Only set switch_id in local_link_connection if it is a mac address

When the processed lldp data is used for setting the local_link_connection
switch_id, it will set it even if the Chassis ID is not a mac.  Need to
only set it when the ChassisId is a mac address, as is done when using
non-processed lldp data.  Ironic validates that switch_id is either a
mac address or OpenFlow datapath ID.

This fixes a regresssion introduced in Pike.

Change-Id: I566acb5b19852b541df7554870ab2666f7df9614
Closes-Bug: 1748022

commit_message:
Remove port definitions from network: section in values.yaml

This removes all standard port definitions from the network:
section in the values files in all charts in osh-infra, and moving
to use endpoint port lookups instead.  This reduces the network:
tree to defining ingress and node ports.

Change-Id: If1daf2238c177707ff950b74c43d9381cbaf4e51

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 16:05:39.000000000', 'message': "RFE: Organize osh-infra chart's values.yamls

This change proposes organizing the values.yaml in charts for
openstack-helm-infra in a standard way.  It places images, labels
and dependencies at the top of the values file and organizes the
remaining trees alphabetically.  For charts that set configuration
with trees in values.yaml, the conf: section is placed at the
bottom of the values.yaml file to prevent large configuration
entries from making the values.yaml unreadable (grafana, for
example).

This work is based on previous discussions around standardizing
the values.yaml files across charts

Change-Id: I08ee96b374933feb1b6c8ba26b45b97968e9eeab

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ib725a3129042c1370e90d56b028a12477d23fa11

commit_message:
Remove unused rally job from heat

As rally team is planning for a new job and the old one is broken,
We should remove the old job for now, and discuss on adding new one
once it's ready.
The `legacy-rally-dsvm-fakevirt-heat` job is up to rally team to
change, so it's not removed by this patch.

Change-Id: Ib77f98b6720c66019c09144cd842b6d4ef78623f

[{'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2017-10-14 15:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-10-14 15:09:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-10-14 15:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Use bash instead of sh when calling deploy-tacker-demo-sfc

This patch is prosed to fix the error when running
deploy-tacker-demo-sfc with sh.

Change-Id: I21d22f89d31d6078f7448fbce16cb133a897a4b6
Closes-Bug: #1749056

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 13:32:33.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Fix Redis TLS setup, including replication traffic

This patch reverts the revert of Redis TLS [1], and fixes the
encryption of Redis replication traffic for HA deployments.

In order to encrypt replication traffic, Redis is configured to
drive outgoing replication traffic to a stunnel endpoint on
<localhost:port_xxx>. Stunnel then manages the encryption up to
the peer Redis master.

Likewise, slave Redis nodes advertise themselves as coming from
<localhost:port_yyy> in order to let the Master initiate connection
the Slave over its own stunnel endpoint, should it needs to.

Each redis node is assigned a unique replication port, and has
dedicated stunnels to each one of its peer. This port mapping
info is used by the redis resource agent to manage A/P failover.

The regular Redis port is unchanged, so Redis clients (OpenStack
services, HAproxy, CLI, firewall) are not impacted by this change.
Only SELinux needs to be adapted.

Note that this feature relies on a currently unmerged version of
resource-agents [2]

[1] I37501c4c983c87e3a38841272eb176ebbe626a65
[2] https://github.com/dciabrin/resource-agents/tree/redis-tunnel

Change-Id: I6cc818973fab25b4cd6f7a0d040aaa05a35c5bb1
Related-bug: #1737707

commit_message:
Fix Redis TLS setup, including replication traffic

This patch reverts the revert of Redis TLS [1], and fixes the
encryption of Redis replication traffic for HA deployments.

In order to encrypt replication traffic, Redis is configured to
drive outgoing replication traffic to a stunnel endpoint on
<localhost:port_xxx>. Stunnel then manages the encryption up to
the peer Redis master.

Likewise, slave Redis nodes advertise themselves as coming from
<localhost:port_yyy> in order to let the Master initiate connection
the Slave over its own stunnel endpoint, should it needs to.

Each redis node is assigned a unique replication port, and has
dedicated stunnels to each one of its peer. This port mapping
info is used by the redis resource agent to manage A/P failover.

The regular Redis port is unchanged, so Redis clients (OpenStack
services, HAproxy, CLI, firewall) are not impacted by this change.
Only SELinux needs to be adapted.

[1] I37501c4c983c87e3a38841272eb176ebbe626a65

Change-Id: I6cc818973fab25b4cd6f7a0d040aaa05a35c5bb1
Related-bug: #1737707

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Lock snapshot/destroy operations

At some point, we've removed the instance snapshot lock, allowing
destroy requests to proceed immediately. We assumed that this
should be fine as long as we're stopping pending WMI jobs.

The issue is that the snapshot operation is still not fully
preemptive. VHD related operations (e.g. copy, merge, upload to
glance) are not preemptive at the moment, for which reason
destroy requests will fail due to file locks.

Unless the new 'force_destroy_instances' config option is enabled
(disabled by default), we're locking the destroy/snapshot operations.

This partially reverts commit
e4208017feb92de8bfbe1c3b28d6b6e3cea7ab2c.

Closes-Bug: #1748394

Change-Id: I3119c5bc5a714be867af19510dfab576f354835b

commit_message:
The description of the range for local_as and remote_as is incorrect in file "base.py"

The range for local_as and remote_as  has been  modified for [MIN_ASNUM,MAX_4BYTE_ASNUM],
so the description of the range should be modified in file "base.py".

Change-Id: Id37af6c571f7fb028c315c61ffffee0fc0482362

In python 3.6, escape sequences that are not
recognized in string literals issue DeprecationWarnings.

Convert these to raw strings.

Change-Id: I0e2bff9cb45974b159aed6a63913a63b1956aa32
'}]
commit_message:
Fix python 3.6 escape char warnings in strings

In python 3.6, escape sequences that are not
recognized in string literals issue DeprecationWarnings.

Convert these to raw strings.

Change-Id: I0e2bff9cb45974b159aed6a63913a63b1956aa32

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I72859fe5f0154dc97fea25f4d9e0bb0a59d0b0fe

commit_message:

The meta-play test-setup-host.yml already includes
test-prepare-containers.yml so there's no need to
re-run it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 15:24:12.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I259343e15340ff7418a40f943e7400b7975391f4
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I259343e15340ff7418a40f943e7400b7975391f4

subject: Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
messages: [{'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-02-13 08:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-02-13 14:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 08:11:54.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/ dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I7d130f1b4a1a00a255ce21742c9d89ba7f2bd90f
'}, {'created': '2018-02-13 09:26:07.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I7d130f1b4a1a00a255ce21742c9d89ba7f2bd90f
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I7d130f1b4a1a00a255ce21742c9d89ba7f2bd90f

commit_message:
Fixes test_device_tagging IndexError

If the metadata_service config option is set to True, the test
test_device_tagging will connect to the spawned instance through ssh
and curl the metadata service and checks the response for the assigned
device tags.

However, not all devices are tagged, causing an IndexError. This patch
solves this issue.

Libvirt only exposes tagged devices, but other drivers (Hyper-V) can
expose other devices as well.

Change-Id: I7570cd81eec09109ad5c74315a7876f53c032240
Closes-Bug: #1747872

commit_message:
ovsfw: Update SG rules even if OVSFW Port is not found

In patch [1] ovs firewall driver was changed and update_port_filter()
method was not trying to initialize port flows in case when
OVSFWPortNotFound is raised.
Without that when e.g. instance is hard rebooted and of_port
number is changed firewall openflow rules were not initialized
for such port and there was no connectivity to such VM.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531414/

Change-Id: I6d917cbac61293e9a956a2efcd9f2b720e4cac95
Closes-Bug: #1747709

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I5e95fce4fd5362fbf1deb23cf8ccad7a86506613

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-10 05:44:59.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I2f8889d4cf41d085f5f2f30e52206d9dfca49f4d
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I2f8889d4cf41d085f5f2f30e52206d9dfca49f4d

[{'created': '2018-02-08 13:58:46.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: If9ce98ce6ebf3bc6c6a70d507b4082b84ea99b80
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: If9ce98ce6ebf3bc6c6a70d507b4082b84ea99b80

commit_message:
tests: test-nova-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I03ad2ae6ded9e13052980694d1122169c1374bb0
(cherry picked from commit 4ff28dc3619374d054e3fc849aafc539841557ae)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 11:02:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix baremetal introspection client creation

We were using deprecated arguments to create the client, which have
been removed in I9df8296ddc1b41cde22ff8b0f26d73c4408741ce.

Also make explicit the keystoneauth1 requirement - the library is
already used in other parts of the code but wasn't explicitly
referenced.

Closes-Bug: #1747057
"}]
commit_message:
Fix baremetal introspection client creation

We were using deprecated arguments to create the client, which have
been removed in I9df8296ddc1b41cde22ff8b0f26d73c4408741ce.

Also make explicit the keystoneauth1 requirement - the library is
already used in other parts of the code but wasn't explicitly
referenced.

Change-Id: I2314020a6414f90d964f7be474668658913e61b9
Closes-Bug: #1747057

commit_message:
Adding docker service for BGPVPN Service Plugin

  BGPVPN Neutron driver is only present in neutron-server-opendaylight
  image. This service will apply its configuration to that image,
  but it should be extensible to other containers such neutron-server
  in the future.

Depends-On: I22023a645c4752c6371b5cea5ab69c7503991887
Change-Id: Ie2b958f67859d285b02af5a80b2a14ccaaf9820a
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Noriega <rnoriega@redhat.com>

oslo.utils: fix compatibility with newer iso8601

Add patch to fix build against newer iso8601 which is needed
for Python 3.x compatibility. The patch is already merged
in oslo.utils master.

[{'created': '2018-02-09 10:45:36.000000000', 'message': "NetApp ONTAP: Copy offload bugfix

When 'NetApp NFS Copy Offload' tool is configured to download Glance
images, these images are downloaded twice because the tool is doing
the job after Cinder has already done it.
This patch fixes the bug by executing the copy offload tool inside the
clone_image function instead of using the copy_image_to_volume.

Closes-bug: #1632333

Change-Id: I5c6ad150543213acfd0c78dbbdb1dc1584d22d26
"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 11:13:24.000000000', 'message': "NetApp ONTAP: Copy offload bugfix

When 'NetApp NFS Copy Offload' tool is configured to download Glance
images, these images are downloaded twice because the tool is doing
the job after Cinder has already done it.
This patch fixes the bug by executing the copy offload tool inside the
clone_image function instead of using the copy_image_to_volume.

Closes-bug: #1632333

Change-Id: I5c6ad150543213acfd0c78dbbdb1dc1584d22d26
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Copy offload bugfix

When 'NetApp NFS Copy Offload' tool is configured to download Glance
images, these images are downloaded twice because the tool is doing
the job after Cinder has already done it.
This patch fixes the bug by executing the copy offload tool inside the
clone_image function instead of using the copy_image_to_volume.

Closes-bug: #1632333

Change-Id: I5c6ad150543213acfd0c78dbbdb1dc1584d22d26

commit_message:
Use a venv with previous ansible version for upgrades

When doing the role upgrade, we run every playbook with current's
branch ansible. This is normal for the infrastructure bits (which
are running on current branch), but not for the installation of
the previous branch's role, which should use previous branch's
environment.

Related-Bug: #1741471
Depends-On: I7ebb045885dd645b820de2b7f75b46c755c015f6
Change-Id: I7bc4dd644c48b403e9e669cb0ea460d9d1149410
(cherry picked from commit e4456ed4c1f7e3506e4698e17dc94b4778517bf9)

commit_message:
tests: test-glance-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I3b4de14b2e98941c948bc23747b85a1a6286b272
(cherry picked from commit f0c7448fa22e1e35283e57ada4633a9263e671e0)

commit_message:
Move the nova-next job in-tree and update it

This moves the legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-nova-next-full
job from openstack-zuul-jobs in-tree and updates a
few things since it's now branch specific:

- The cells v2 and placement stuff can be removed since those
  are required now (they were optional when this job would run
  against newton changes).
- Use nova/gate/post_test_hook.sh rather than the symlink under
  nova/tools/hooks/.

The job is currently non-voting and needs to remain that way
until bug 1747511 is fixed.

According to the branch restrictions in project-config, apparently
this job is only running against stable/newton (which no longer
exists) and master, presumably when master was pike. We should also
run this job against stable/pike for the service user test coverage
and post_test_hook.sh run, so we'll likely backport this change
to stable/pike as well.

The related project-config change is:

I36d96f89b3e5323746fcbcef5cc7e4d0384a184d

Change-Id: I24a5f73c29094a23e2fdef8ee8b43601300af593

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 18:45:48.000000000', 'message': "ironic_inspector: ironic: Fix 'auth_type' when 'auth_strategy' is used

We should override the 'auth_type' to 'none' when using the old way of
setting up authentication with 'auth_strategy' so we can override the
default 'auth_type' value before getting the session information.
This fixes the following issue

Unhandled error: MissingRequiredOptions: Auth plugin requires parameters which were not given: auth_url

This also adds a new testcase to test the strategy='noauth' scenario.

Closes-Bug: #1748263
Change-Id: I875e2b17f5c6829ad81f86c32959cb106bf57e53
(cherry picked from commit fbeb0783e4b2f1fc5f44da7f7b704ce48bfe0087)
"}]
commit_message:
ironic_inspector: ironic: Fix 'auth_type' when 'auth_strategy' is used

We should override the 'auth_type' to 'none' when using the old way of
setting up authentication with 'auth_strategy' so we can override the
default 'auth_type' value before getting the session information.
This fixes the following issue

Unhandled error: MissingRequiredOptions: Auth plugin requires parameters which were not given: auth_url

This also adds a new testcase to test the strategy='noauth' scenario.

Closes-Bug: #1748263
Change-Id: I875e2b17f5c6829ad81f86c32959cb106bf57e53
(cherry picked from commit fbeb0783e4b2f1fc5f44da7f7b704ce48bfe0087)

messages: [{'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-02-13 08:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:26:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 08:22:14.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/ dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I92902bc27da736fb6bd5915ec8a9cd20222aceeb
'}, {'created': '2018-02-13 09:26:58.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I92902bc27da736fb6bd5915ec8a9cd20222aceeb
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I92902bc27da736fb6bd5915ec8a9cd20222aceeb

commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox jobs

Convert all tox jobs to be Zuul v3 native. This uses the shared
openstack-tox as base.

Add doc/requirements.txt
Fix doc building with new PTI changes and job updates.

Add a doc/requirements.txt file with all needed dependencies.

Change-Id: Ic89940a03e308fab051b8051ff281724e6488306
(cherry picked from commit bbe3a4300a399988fc2659359713869a8cbb641a)
(cherry picked from commit e7afb739bfa1dec8d9b3dbbaea25243c6931a2f5)

commit_message:
Add upload plan-environment action for update and upgrade

In order to re-used the Deploy functionnalities, we need
to upload the plan-environment when updating the plan, in
order to keep the user data in place during the update
and upgrade

Change-Id: Ica4bb404cd3a38a97300b8af36af41c35f09825c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 16:07:09.000000000', 'message': "Run overcloud-ssl role with default quickstart.sh tags

The default tags don't include overcloud-ssl, but this needs to
be included for the case where this combination is used:

undercloud_generate_service_certificate: true
ssl_overcloud: false

In this case we don't generate inject-trust-anchor.yaml which
means the overcloud deploy script is broken.

Change-Id: I42e94f6791e3de1af09bee7c2b5c64201283ae9e
"}]
commit_message:
Run overcloud-ssl role with default quickstart.sh tags

The default tags don't include overcloud-ssl, but this needs to
be included for the case where this combination is used:

undercloud_generate_service_certificate: true
ssl_overcloud: false

In this case we don't generate inject-trust-anchor.yaml which
means the overcloud deploy script is broken.

Change-Id: I42e94f6791e3de1af09bee7c2b5c64201283ae9e

commit_message:
Improve logs on scheduler

Scheduler decisions still not easy to track due lacking of information
about backends and pools. This adds more verbose information on that
so we can have a better means to help debug problems.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I4a59ed298ba2542dcb4d6787b47085749a34244e

commit_message:
use qos default api def from neutron-lib

Commit If59765fe1f293d4ca6f80f62b22a420a388dfb68 rehomed the qos default
extension's API definition into neutron-lib. This patch consumes it
by removing the rehomed code and using lib's API definition instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ifd29134de594ee64941361195c50dac664c5b6b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 11:24:09.000000000', 'message': 'Windows: fix connectors 'disconnect_volume' signature

The Windows connectors do not include the 'device_info' argument
in the 'disconnect_volume' method.

This wasn't an issue for Nova as the Hyper-V driver doesn't pass
this argument, yet Cinder does pass it, which will lead to an
exception.

This change adds the missing argument, defaulting to "None" so that
it won't break the Nova Hyper-V driver.

Change-Id: Iaf8b57c97afc393862a61a7338a35f008b65c8c1
Closes-Bug: #1738390
'}]
commit_message:
Windows: fix connectors 'disconnect_volume' signature

The Windows connectors do not include the 'device_info' argument
in the 'disconnect_volume' method.

This wasn't an issue for Nova as the Hyper-V driver doesn't pass
this argument, yet Cinder does pass it, which will lead to an
exception.

This change adds the missing argument, defaulting to "None" so that
it won't break the Nova Hyper-V driver.

Change-Id: Iaf8b57c97afc393862a61a7338a35f008b65c8c1
Closes-Bug: #1738390

commit_message:
Enable hacking-extensions H204, H205

This patch enable extensions:
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I89efcab9993fcbb187249e32712fe00b86715e3a

commit_message:
update goal process to use storyboard for tracking

As discussed on the mailing list [1], we want to use storyboard for
tracking goals progress instead of patches here in the governance
repository. We will build the tools needed for that in a separate repo
managed by the goal champions [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126189.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/533761

Change-Id: I4be381327f28debea6b085e9328179a143353125
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from update-pike-uca-stable/pike to update-pike-uca'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-23 18:51:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Why is this needed in stable? Is something blocked because we don't have this? Otherwise I'd rather not change the packages we've been using in pike for nearly a year now."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-01-23 19:20:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Why is this needed in stable? Is something blocked because we don't
 > have this? Otherwise I'd rather not change the packages we've been
 > using in pike for nearly a year now.

I noticed an odd build issue with the Ocata UCA libvirt package [1] while testing Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355 in Ie0b188d0dac50b8ad2287ad86774fbd63a644b57. This resulted in the legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration job failing as it uses stable/pike and in turn the Ocata UCA during the initial deployment.

I can understand that we don't want to make large disruptive changes to stable/pike, however we are essentially testing a useless combination of stable/pike and the Ocata UCA that nobody is and will ever use in the real world at present. I still think this is worth changing for that reason alone.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libvirt/+bug/1744758"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 15:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 15:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Skip integration tests for lifecycle hooks

Skipping lifecycle hook integration tests because we are not able
to get message service at CI gate. The reason could be that SDK failed
to register zaqar as a 'messaging' service.

Change-Id: I1d0b251e2a9b80ed48307fbdfc952f909e39edaa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 16:33:06.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id05936f8063a980daca11d050c7707d9ff75502f
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id05936f8063a980daca11d050c7707d9ff75502f

commit_message:
Document the error code on conditional update/delete

The API reference document the conditional update/delete feature,
but the documentation of error code is missing. This patch adds
this missing information.

Change-Id: Ia91d7cb7b0a082f058cb99510f84b4865830e0a2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-12 09:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from mox_removal to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-12 15:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-01-12 16:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:40:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

I agree with the need for some pointers to some examples.

I think this would make a pretty good goal as it will cause eyes to look at code that hasn't been looked at in a long time, a good thing.

What I worry about, though, is people blindly changing mox code to mock code without stopping to inspect whether the test using mocks (of any kind) is correct and appropriate. It might be helpful to annotate the goal with a clarification that the intent is not simply to get rid of mox, but to revisit and tune tests to be their best.

(I state this as someone who thinks that too many mocks is a very bad thing, and a sign of difficult-to-maintain code.)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-17 19:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-19 06:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-19 09:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from mox_removal to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-21 15:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2018-01-22 08:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-01-22 11:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1

Its a painful one, but it does need doing soon ish.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1

I think we should definitely choose this one. Gotta be done.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 11:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-01-23 20:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 20:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-01-23 23:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-26 14:51:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Nove has tried removing mox over the years, and we've left it as a low-hanging fruit item for new contributors as well. Looking at master, rough count of ReplayAll calls is 352 and self.stubs.Set is 421 (the latter could be multiple times per test of course).

We've also said, since at least Havana I think, that new tests shouldn't be using mox, and changes to existing tests using mox should be re-written in mock.

I don't think Nova at least can probably attain this goal in Rocky given reviewer bandwidth and the number of tests that still require conversion. Reviewing these types of test conversion changes is not trivial since you have to be sure you're not losing some kind of subtle test coverage. Given other priorities that we have, for actual users, I would have to be a -1 on this at least wrt Nova."}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-01-26 17:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-26 17:59:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Rollcall-Vote

I'm switching my rollcall from yes back to abstain for now given Matt's stated concerns over it being infeasible for Nova over the course of the coming cycle. Perhaps proponents should consider reproposing for the S cycle if additional traction has been made in some of the older projects by then, or else look for further ways to decrease the burden this goal would otherwise place on reviewers?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-28 22:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1

We need to be working to drop our use of unsupported tools. The conversion work off of mox3 may take some projects longer than one cycle, but I would like to see a drive to make some progress.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-06 09:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-06 14:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Rollcall-Vote'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:47:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I've been watching with interest the philosophical debate about whether it's OK to approve a community goal that we don't expect to meet. IMHO it's not, and I'd like to register my philosophical objection here.

The justification for the existence of community goals is to solve problems that would otherwise fall under the 'tragedy of the commons'. If there's a task from which we only get the benefit if *everyone* does it, then the incentive is to ignore it on the basis that somebody else probably will too, and that therefore there would be no benefit anyway. Community goals build confidence that *everyone* will in fact complete the task, and therefore assure developers that their effort will not be in vain (and, in fact, that they will likely be the ones letting their peers down if they don't do the work).

Mox removal is a good candidate for a community goal. We want to stop maintaining mox3, and we can only do that once all existing tests are converted. A goal can help co-ordinate the process.

However, if we know in advance that one or more project will be unable to complete the goal in the prescribed time (as Matt has indicated is the case with Nova), then the existence of the goal fails in it's purpose to build confidence. In fact, it telegraphs that effort spent by other projects in meeting the artificial deadline will certainly be wasted. (Note: if there's a group that hates externally-imposed meaningless artificial deadlines more than software developers do then... I guess I don't follow any of them on Twitter.)

Simply put, this is an invitation to ignore the goal and, by extension, all community goals - because in a confidence-building process success breeds success.

If we don't believe this goal is achievable by all projects in Rocky, then one option might be to pre-announce it as an approved goal for the Spree cycle, to give those teams that need it time to get started, and other teams flexibility in when to focus their efforts. (Admittedly the distinction between this and a multi-cycle goal is fairly academic.)"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-06 19:58:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

FTR, I'm not suggesting that nova won't work on more mox removal in Rocky, as I said before, we've already done this for a few releases as low-hanging-fruit type work for new contributors (OSIC and some other groups were working on this). I expect we'd do similar in Rocky if this goal is approved, I just can't say it will get high priority review attention to get it *done*, but I expect progress could be made, and agree with Doug that that is worthwhile on it's own."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-06 20:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Also, FTR, I don't think mox3 maintenance and the need to retire it is a worthwhile justification for making this a high priority for teams in Rocky. To compare with a similar situation, openstack forked the sqlalchemy-migrate library years ago and still maintain it, and there are rarely if ever updates to it, yet we don't prioritize as a community wide goal the idea of moving projects from sqla-migrate to alembic, even though that would arguably be a more worthwhile use of our time if we're worried about dropping usage of old libraries."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-02-06 21:07:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

As Matt mentioned earlier, in Nova we have hundreds of uses of mox functions in our legacy unit tests. Converting them isn't trivial because developers and reviewers spend time and effort making sure test coverage is preserved in the conversion.

We are trying to be realistic and honest about how much we can achieve this goal (100% conversion). Like everyone else, we have loads of bug fix and feature work every cycle that demands a lot of development and review time. Those are our high priority activities.

I understand we should move away from obsolete tools. We have mox3 and I'm not aware that it takes significant effort to maintain. AFAIU, it is seldom changed. By mentioning this I mean to point out that we have a safety net here and that we are not under emergency pressure to remove our dependency on an external library that could disappear at any moment.

We can make some progress in the mox -> mock conversion during the cycle as a low priority activity, if it is acceptable for the community goal not to reach 100%, but to make progress."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-06 21:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Would it make sense to set the goal as a 50% reduction in calls to mox(3) functions over the course of the rocky cycle, and get affected projects to commit to that instead?'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-06 22:11:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Would it make sense to set the goal as a 50% reduction in calls to mox(3) functions over the course of the rocky cycle, and get affected projects to commit to that instead?

It may make sense for Nova (and maybe anyone else in the same boat) to set that goal for themselves. IMHO it doesn't make sense as a community-wide goal, because it fails the solves-a-tragedy-of-the-commons-problem test. (i.e. there's nothing we can do collectively, like abandon mox3, after a 50% reduction that we couldn't do before.)"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-06 23:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Sure, I get that. I was mostly wondering whether it could serve as a means of getting to "we'd like to complete this over the next two cycles" while having a clear threshold which all teams need to meet the first half of that timeframe.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-07 10:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

This may impact Sahara, as we have a lot of tests in sahara-dashboard which uses mox and its "register-and-replay" paradigm, and on the other side we may have some troubles dealing with the porting (very low manpower on the dashboard). This is maybe on the level of anecdote and it may or should not block a global goal, but as Sahara contributor I think we may be able to do it for Rocky, and other dashboards are probably in the same state.

The proposal does not address the porting away from that paradigm but just mention "examples".

Are there proper number about the status of mox?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-07 17:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

My thoughts on this goal are a bit split.

On one hand, the goal says that project teams need to spend a significant amount of effort / person-hours just to end up with something they already had: the same amount of unit test coverage. And that doesn't seem fair, because the reason for this goal being proposed is "we don't want to support our fork of mox", despite the fact that it seems to take (from what I can tell) far less effort to maintain the fork than to convert the tests.

On the other hand, perhaps it's naive to assume making the transition from mox->mock is entirely fruitless. Thinking again in the sahara-dashboard case, it's true that we generally avoid writing tests nowadays because no one knows mox. So perhaps by taking this difficult step to convert the tests, it will make it easier to write tests in the future. There is something funny there, that we need to learn mox only for the sake of abandoning it. Maybe a better goal is the more abstract idea of "we should learn mox".

I dunno.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-07 17:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-07 19:05:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

It's an unfortunate law of engineering that the urgency to remove a temporary solution is rarely as powerful as the urgency under which the solution was implemented. This unofficial fork of mox was created to give projects who were using it a stop-gap so Python 3 testing could proceed independently of the agreed-upon need to switch to mock. In retrospect, perhaps this was a bad idea because we traded technical debt for technical debt. We could have instead just told people who wanted working Python 3 testing it would have to wait for the mox->mock transition to complete (and they could pitch in on that in the interim if so inclined). Count this in the lessons learned since 2012.

I haven't seen this mentioned yet, but there appears to be another actively maintained mox fork claiming Python 2.7 and 3.3-3.5 support: https://pypi.org/project/pymox/ Perhaps this would provide a compromise between projects who want to put off the mock transition longer, and the Oslo team's desire to drop mox3?"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote-1

The current goals are working well because we have one that is medium-effort that everyone agrees is very important, and one that, while maybe no one would have implemented on their own, is very low effort. If the community deems this goal to be very high-effort and we do not have consensus on its importance, then this is not a suitable community goal at this time.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-09 10:18:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think that beyond reducing Oslo team maintenance cost (which could also be mitigated by switching to pymox) the real objective here is to standardize on a single mocking framework, to reduce learning curve in contributing to OpenStack.

I still think it's a worthwhile goal to have, even if we expect it will take a longer time for Nova team to complete it.

This goal (and the current objections to it) was discussed at the TC office hour yesterday. It still has majority support (combined with the mutable debug one) and will be approved on Tuesday unless new objections are posted."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-10 05:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add Rocky goal to remove mox

We've been talking about the need to remove mox for some time
now. This proposes to make it a goal for the Rocky release to
finally get everyone switched over to using mock.

Change-Id: I1c0138d3ee4403cf16aa806f8fe692ebcfd08341

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I242e6fac493b710e4c61d80f8b594a6c84277fa3

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I58360e1243088ac0e47e57edb2275f8dd8af31e5

*_use_fqdn in ceph-ansible basing on the value set for
EnableInternalTLS parameter.

Also see I14a88bd3bc91ccf6cc61d2592b823f3a92d74fec

With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-01-17 03:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-01-17 03:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think this is an admirable goal but given the number of projects and the sometimes >1 services per project, I wonder if it is a bit too big of an undertaking for a single cycle.

What might be more possible is to narrow the scope to get the immediate use case of "make it possible to turn on debug by sending a HUP to a process". This would still be driven by mutability in oslo_config, but only one config item would be considered for mutation, initially.

Does that make things smaller, or not?'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-01-18 12:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think this is an admirable goal but given the number of projects
 > and the sometimes >1 services per project, I wonder if it is a bit
 > too big of an undertaking for a single cycle.
 > 
 > What might be more possible is to narrow the scope to get the
 > immediate use case of "make it possible to turn on debug by sending
 > a HUP to a process". This would still be driven by mutability in
 > oslo_config, but only one config item would be considered for
 > mutation, initially.
 > 
 > Does that make things smaller, or not?

good point, this is measurable goal :-). Specific project will decide which other congfiguration option will be marked as 'mutable'.  would like to update in a following patchset after collecting more input.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-19 09:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from mutate_configuration to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:51:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I love cdent's suggestion here, ability to turn on and off debug logging using SIG_HUP for all services is a great initial goal.

The big, not accidental, win is that it will make everyone aware of the feature, and make it easy for operators to propose new configurations params that could do to be mutable.

There are some nice patterns around resetting caches of things on SIG_HUP, which is probably also worth mentioning. i.e. on upgrade, prefer SIG_HUP over full restart, but I know the goal was to make this smaller... so that is for another cycle."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:30:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add Rocky goal to toggle the debug option at runtime

There is a strong desire from operators to be able to change
configuration options without a service restart, it really
would make happy our operators. This goal will focus on
toggle the debug option for each service at runtime.

Change-Id: I6bb586a7a2e1e9a4d31afbe330923e8e3f37e681

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 00:49:45.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly adding --require-kubeconfig for kubelet

Kubelet could fail to talk k8s API server if version is under 1.8.x,
because for k8s version under 1.8.x, it's still expecting the parameter
--require-kubeconfig. So let's add it explicitly to avoid failing to
start kubelet on minion nodes. See [1] for more details about this issue.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36745
[2] https://www.projectatomic.io/blog/2017/10/fedora-atomic-26-oct-16/

Closes-Bug: #1749033

Change-Id: I89c9e7f4c1bea479ae3e8f0a8b4ba165ca4cd9c2
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly adding --require-kubeconfig for kubelet

Kubelet could fail to talk k8s API server if version is under 1.8.x,
because for k8s version under 1.8.x, it's still expecting the parameter
--require-kubeconfig. So let's add it explicitly to avoid failing to
start kubelet on minion nodes. See [1] for more details about this issue.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36745
[2] https://www.projectatomic.io/blog/2017/10/fedora-atomic-26-oct-16/

Closes-Bug: #1749033

Change-Id: I89c9e7f4c1bea479ae3e8f0a8b4ba165ca4cd9c2

What do y'all think ? Doable within a cycle ? Or more of a S goal ?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Should we look for someone to work on it ?'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-11-28 15:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:46:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Here is the storyboard item for tracking progress on Stories being able to be private: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2000568

It's a little over half way done. I reiterated in our meeting today that we need to get this done in order to get the goal accepted, but we don't really have the manpower to do it. If we could get someone working on it I don't expect it would take all that long to implement especially if they are somewhat familiar with Launchpad and its apis. The hard part is just testing everything since it would require someone from the VMT to run."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-30 19:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> This goal looks good, I just fear it's not doable within a cycle at
 > this stage in Storyboard adoption.
 > 
 > Goals are great to catch the long tail of OpenStack teams and get
 > them to align with the state of early adopters. For Storyboard I
 > feel like we are still in early adopters phase.
 > 
 > My suggestion would be to get a few big names migrated during
 > Queens/Rocky, and use the goal in "S" to migrate stragglers.
 > 
 > What do y'all think ? Doable within a cycle ? Or more of a S goal ?

The original point of writing this goal up was to identify any missing features that would hold us back from adoption. Having some sort of documentation about how to use the UI should be high on that list, along with finishing the work on private tickets.

Perhaps we should spend some time identifying other items so we can work on those during Rocky and consider migrating during S.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-01 09:25:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Note: we'll have to wait for more goals to be posted before we make the selection anyway, so don't expect a vote on this one too soon."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2017-12-12 09:54:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

If hard to me to see much benefits in Storyboard, other than a decent result of NIH syndrome, but I also find Launchpad less than ideal.

My question would be why not using JIRA instead? I really doubt there is any other issue tracker and planning tool more versatile than it. And is clearly able to cope with complex projects like openstack. 

JIRA is free for any open source project, can use multiple SSO system for login. 

I am pretty sure we could get more results by investing much less than now. Sometimes is better to spend time configuring something than coding, especially when your goal is not to produce an issue tracker or a planning too.

PS. Also a typo in commit message. "relase"'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

"Free for any open source project" is not even remotely the same thing as free software or open source.

People are free to go use whatever proprietary solutions they want in my opinion (e.g., many already use Trello), but we'd like to be able to offer a multi-project task and defect tracking solution which is entirely free and open so that projects who have an ideological interest in the free software movement (I thought the OpenStack community did?) can use and help improve it rather than sending the signal that free software is only good for certain things and people shouldn't bother building free replacements of some sorts of proprietary applications.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-12-12 20:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-12-12 20:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from add_sb to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-13 01:54:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Rollcall-Vote-1

First of all, thanks Kendall for taking time to write this proposal.
I'll rephrase here what I wrote on IRC during the office hour:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2017-12-13.log.html#t2017-12-13T01:19:16

I think:

* Launchpad isn't the best tool, but it's my opinion.
* Launchpad isn't maintained by an Open Infrastructure.
* Storyboard is a great project and has a huge potential in the future to be the default bug tracker for most of OpenStack projects.

That said, I don't think this migration should not be a goal.
Here's why:

* No big project (like Nova, Neutron, TripleO), with thousands of bugs have made the move yet.
* Zuul v3 transition wasn't easy and it brought a bunch of disruption for our community (days of downtime for some project). Not sure we want to repeat that again.
* I don't think we have enough champions for this goal (at this time) to successfully migrate projects within one cycle.
* A bunch of community members don't want disruption and frequent big changes. Some members might also think we're writing our own tools for everything (some of them could wonder if we'll rewrite Gerrit?). It doesn't reflect my opinion but I've talked with these kind of people.

I'll maintain -1 for this goal as it stands now.
What I would like to see first is one or 2 pilot projects (like Nova, Neutron or TripleO), having heavy load of bugs every day, having a lot of contributors, making the move and ready to feel some pain in case some things go wrong. The champion would closely work with the pilot to drive this goal successfully.

Once the pilot is done, and we have maybe one or 2 more champions, then I'm fine to make it a goal.
Again, I'm all for changing the tool. What I'm against now, is to make it a goal, without having testing the result on one big project, and with only one champion now."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-09 22:28:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Rollcall-Vote-1

I'm in agreement with Emilien here. I do think it will be good to migrate off of Launchpad to Storyboard, but I'm not comfortable with this being a Rocky goal. That seems way too aggressive of a goal at this point.

I would like to see this happen over multiple cycles. I think we need to give projects some time to adjust to the new workflow without seeming to force it on them as a TC goal.

I would also like to see a few more (larger) pilot projects to help work out any issues before we start moving everyone over wholesale."}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-01-15 11:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-01-26 20:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> I'm in agreement with Emilien here. I do think it will be good to
 > migrate off of Launchpad to Storyboard, but I'm not comfortable
 > with this being a Rocky goal. That seems way too aggressive of a
 > goal at this point.
 > 
 > I would like to see this happen over multiple cycles. I think we
 > need to give projects some time to adjust to the new workflow
 > without seeming to force it on them as a TC goal.
 > 
 > I would also like to see a few more (larger) pilot projects to help
 > work out any issues before we start moving everyone over wholesale.

I might be treading on a question that's already been answered, but I thought the batch migration was a major part of how the whole migration works because of how bugs associate with multiple projects? That doesn't appear to be the case anymore?"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-01-26 20:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:24:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

It's more that it would have been preferable to migrate all projects with shared bugs at the same time, but it's since become apparent that some projects may want to migrate sooner, or later, or even perhaps never so if we hold out for everyone to be ready it'll never happen.

Ultimately, while bug divergence is unfortunate, it's a mostly temporary effect as the migration tool handles incrementally pulling in updates (bugtask additions, status changes, new comments) for bugs which have been previously imported. And worst case, permanent divergence (because of some projects opting to never move off LP or deciding to move their defect/task tracking somewhere else besides SB) is no worse than if those projects had never been using the same tracker as the rest anyway. There's plenty of other software out there which shares bugs in common from time to time and they manage to get by even when not using the same trackers."}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-01-29 17:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-30 23:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-30 23:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-30 23:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from add_sb to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-30 23:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Published edit on patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-30 23:22:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Published edit on patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-01-31 12:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:23:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Rollcall-Vote-1

I want us to do this, but I don't think storyboard is ready for us, yet."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:29:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Rollcall-Vote-1

I'll re-add my vote from my previous comments, I like the goal but I don't think it's the good time now. Tt doesn't mean we need to stop our efforts, actually we need to work in the community. I also think it could be a multi-cycle goal, since it's not that easy for big projects."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

That goal was not selected for Rocky. Please consider filing it for S !'}]

Add Storyboard Migration to Rocky

This patch proposes the migration to Storyboard
as a release goal. It also removes the placeholder
propose_entries_here file.

(1 comment)

Couple questions on how we're going to work with this in keystone, where we can't guarantee specific ordering from some backends."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Keystone will need to have an exception.

Users and other data that is potentially backed by LDAP cannot have pagination. This is because of the way LDAP handles pagination in general. LDAP requires an active cursor that would need to be communicated across processes/active keystones (multiple nodes?). LDAP responses are not consistent in order so multiple requests will render totally different results for the 1st page.

Since users are commonly in LDAP, even with the shadow user mechanisms, there is a hard requirement to exempt users from needing pagination (and a hard -2 for adding it into keystone).

This is the only hard requirement for adding in pagination, keystone will need an exception for any/all data backed by LDAP (primarily users) in some cases.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:51:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Monty informed us this wont require any additional pagination for resources that don't paginate. the -1 and keystone concerns are rescinded then."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I think this should be stronger about what should not be done.

Also I think the tempest requirement (at least without more justification) is too much.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-17 16:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-17 16:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-26 16:05:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I don't think I can agree with requiring that tempest tests are added for all of these. I think in-tree functional testing would be fine, unless a project has it's own tempest plugin that adds the tests there and they aren't required to be run in co-gating situations."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-26 16:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-26 16:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck now that the POST_FAILURE results should hopefully be behind us again'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:26:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote-1

This one doesn't feel quite ready for Rocky. Maybe for S."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

That goal was not selected for Rocky. Please consider filing it for S !'}]

commit_message:
Add Rocky goal to ensure pagination links

Recent work on openstacksdk highlighted that the way services return (or
don't return) links informing API consumers about paginated results is
inconsistent. This makes consuming the API consistently and confidently
difficult.

At the very least we should be returning pagination links that can be
counted on.

Change-Id: Ib1df0c3a4696bc8b5685eb13917a59b92b80dca0
