[{'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-01-15 08:01:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-15 18:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

looks good to me so far, thanks for proposing it!'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-15 20:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-16 08:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from cold-upgrades-cap to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-01-17 09:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:35:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree that we should not limit this to a bucket of projects. Or, as doug says, it's not openstack-wide.

That said, upgrading is one of those areas where I don't really feel that how we upgrade in the gate (grenade + devstack) bears all that much relation to how distributions (and custom installations) do (or even should do) upgrading. So it seems artificial to me, to some extent, and feels like a lot of effort spent on something that is going to be different once the code is packaged or otherwise accessed through tooling.

Tooling which will be very different depending on how you choose to manage your OpenStack. Given all that plus a mix of naiveity and idealism that doesn't reflect the real world, I'd much rather see upgrade concerns be downstream of _here_.

I assume that's not going to happen, and since it is not, I can see that having this goal would be a good step in the direction of indicating a kind of maturity for more projects."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-19 13:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like it because it is an operators-facing improvement, it impacts a limited number of projects and raises the quality bar as to what we mean by "being an OpenStack service".'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-19 14:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Chris: while it only tests one way to do the upgrade, that testing  generally uncovers issues that would have broken everyone else, like incompatible config file changes. So while it does not directly test it the way, say, Ubuntu does upgrades, I think it still makes the distro lives easier...'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-21 15:24:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I'm generally in favor of the idea, and agree that while our current upgrade testing may be for a rarefied sort of situation/environment it at last demonstrates _a_ means of upgrading is made possible by upstream developers (as opposed to not bothering to even confirm it's remotely possible in the least).

That said, I'm hesitant to vote while it still has [WIP] in the commit subject."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-22 16:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Masayuki, can you please remove WIP from the commit message and address comments, so maybe we could move forward this week with the votes. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:31:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Masayuki, can you please remove WIP from the commit message and
 > address comments, so maybe we could move forward this week with the
 > votes. Thanks!

Emilien, Thanks for your comment! I just updated the patch. But I didn't change the list of service projects yet. I think there are still some discussion for that."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> @Chris: while it only tests one way to do the upgrade, that testing
 >  generally uncovers issues that would have broken everyone else,
 > like incompatible config file changes. So while it does not
 > directly test it the way, say, Ubuntu does upgrades, I think it
 > still makes the distro lives easier...

Yeah, I know all that, thus the comments about idealism.

I think this goal is of a class where it should be driven by the downstream. If they want to see it happen they should provide labour to do it such that existing labour is not taken from whatever they would be doing otherwise. Of if they are, there are replacements for the loss. I think that contribution should be explicit.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think this goal is of a class where it should be driven by the
 > downstream. If they want to see it happen they should provide
 > labour to do it such that existing labour is not taken from
 > whatever they would be doing otherwise. Of if they are, there are
 > replacements for the loss. I think that contribution should be
 > explicit.

That seems to suppose that the downstream is always a vendor with a monetary interest in supporting upgrades. That's not the case, there are operators who consume OpenStack without an intermediary vendor. Moreover, some "vendors" are packagers that don't necessarily get involved with all of the details of upgrading, like database migrations. I don't agree that upgrades should be considered a "downstream" problem, we should be ensuring that what we produce upstream is at least theoretically capable of being upgraded.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> 
 > That seems to suppose that the downstream is always a vendor with a
 > monetary interest in supporting upgrades. That's not the case,
 > there are operators who consume OpenStack without an intermediary
 > vendor. Moreover, some "vendors" are packagers that don't
 > necessarily get involved with all of the details of upgrading, like
 > database migrations. I don't agree that upgrades should be
 > considered a "downstream" problem, we should be ensuring that what
 > we produce upstream is at least theoretically capable of being
 > upgraded.

http://p.anticdent.org/23nq:

"in case it's not clear, I mostly agree with you on the upgrade situation, but I'm trying to push the point that we can't keep adding tasks without adding people, and the upgrades one is a relatively easy one to use for that"'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-23 16:22:26.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from cold-upgrades-cap to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 21:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-25 15:59:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Given the importance of upgrades to our users, I support this goal. I would prefer to have the comments about limiting the work to only some projects removed but if others feel strongly that we can't accomplish the goal with that broad of a scope I could support it as it stands."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-26 15:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-26 23:04:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I'm not opposed to the overall idea, but if we decide that this is expected of every service then once the goal is completed we should move the tag description into our list of required features and get rid of the tag itself, right? Seems like there would be little point to a tag which every project has."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-02-06 08:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This goal would be my plan B in case the mox one is finally rejected.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Add Cold upgrades capabilities

This proposes to make service projects to support cold upgrades and
have a "assert:supports-upgrade" tag[0]. This goal would mostly
benefit the operators community as we would continue to ensure
OpenStack can be upgraded and we actually test it in the gate.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/assert_supports-upgrade.html

Change-Id: I47976962872fa972f799ef59f235d745e434145e

commit_message:
Don't override session during auth

Looks like we try to override the session even if we don't auth, let's
not do that.

Change-Id: I520c3d020e3415c5737af7912bddf34931190d65
Closes-Bug: #1748751
(cherry picked from commit f5816f1d79a04679dafd8a5e8b0c344148246306)

Update available nodes counts real time when changing counts

* Use form data to calculate available nodes
* fix getNodeCountParametersByRoleFromFormValues selector

commit_message:
Dedicate Queens release to Shawn Pearce

Shawn passed away from cancer in January. He was the founder of the
Gerrit project, which is an integral part of how OpenStack works. This
dedication resolution, in fact, is going to be submitted to a gerrit server
where it will be reviewed and voted on.

Change-Id: I6a39ac36cf383de035ba4a3deba4b68032e5c918

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 14:33:00.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iec3d659b8324a7eec7acfdc471136673683167b4
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iec3d659b8324a7eec7acfdc471136673683167b4

Move extensions_to_txt to the job defintion

Move extensions_to_txt to the job defintion so that it
may be extended by descendant jobs.

commit_message:
Don't override session during auth

Looks like we try to override the session even if we don't auth, let's
not do that.

Change-Id: I520c3d020e3415c5737af7912bddf34931190d65
Closes-Bug: #1748751

commit_message:
bagpipe-l2 agent extension must only support VXLAN

Correct bagpipe-l2 agent extension to only handle ports plugged on VXLAN
network type.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I6ccc879f080a0614a3a0fec71fcd3d29bee423ad
Closes-Bug: 1748870

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 23:19:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ceilometer deployment

This change fixes the following issues:

- wrong sudoers command
- bad arguments for ceilometer-upgrade

Please note that due to the aforementioned issues, ceilometer
deployment was failing. I first encountered this issue when
attempting to upgrade from pike to queens

Change-Id: Ibdfed9ea0a8e4aaf4fe3420a5885ea346998f1e7
Closes-Bug: 1741536
'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 23:26:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ceilometer deployment

This change fixes the following issues:

- wrong sudoers command
- bad arguments for ceilometer-upgrade

Please note that due to the aforementioned issues, ceilometer
deployment was failing. I first encountered this issue when
attempting to upgrade from pike to queens.

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer deployment

This change fixes the following issues:

- wrong sudoers command
- bad arguments for ceilometer-upgrade
- removes the deprecated storage backends,
  as per https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512700/

Please note that due to the aforementioned issues, ceilometer
deployment was failing. I first encountered this issue when
attempting to upgrade from pike to queens.

Change-Id: Ibdfed9ea0a8e4aaf4fe3420a5885ea346998f1e7
Closes-Bug: 1741536

commit_message:
Use absolute path in install_pip macro

This lets us use the macro in the case there was a WORKDIR instruction
that changed the working directory from / earlier in the dockerfile.

Change-Id: I2369c9997ef189e7084fac7b5ace014f6f76d698
Closes-Bug: #1746682

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I41598cdb13b67b3d7f0f24622a07243bf7972287

commit_message:
Allow non fully qualified hostnames for undercloud

The validation checks that the hostname (fully qualified or not) is
present in the /etc/hosts file and adds it to /etc/hosts otherwise.

Previously the _check_hostname() function would raise an exception if
it had to write the hostname to /etc/hosts and it was not fully
qualified.

This patch make it accept non fully qualified hostnames to match the
actual check.

Change-Id: I86fe89c328df116e1902894a059d4284800ba8f9
Closes-Bug: #1737356

messages: [{'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-02-12 22:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-02-13 05:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nThanks Jiri.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 15:57:10.000000000', 'message': "Improve debugging possibilities for docker-puppet.py time handling

We faced issue where on some environments docker-puppet.py picks up
/etc/hosts as modified, even though that shouldn't be the case (LP bug
1709689). On the last occasion we found the cause to be desynced time
on the host machine of a virtual setup, and subsequent NTP sync of
overcloud nodes (causing a 5 hour skip back in time) racing with
docker-puppet.py.

Still, more info to debug these kinds of issues would be nice to
have. Printing the timestamp of origin_of_time, saving it to a
persistent directory and making sure /etc/localtime is mounted into
docker-puppet containers should make finding the root cause on such
occasions easier.

Change-Id: I2ea197673b470379ead295058b6952cce3a69606
Closes-Bug: #1737954
(cherry picked from commit 51a3b05f4ec952d99935fdbbc64347c0404fd29b)
"}]
commit_message:
Improve debugging possibilities for docker-puppet.py time handling

We faced issue where on some environments docker-puppet.py picks up
/etc/hosts as modified, even though that shouldn't be the case (LP bug
1709689). On the last occasion we found the cause to be desynced time
on the host machine of a virtual setup, and subsequent NTP sync of
overcloud nodes (causing a 5 hour skip back in time) racing with
docker-puppet.py.

Still, more info to debug these kinds of issues would be nice to
have. Printing the timestamp of origin_of_time, saving it to a
persistent directory and making sure /etc/localtime is mounted into
docker-puppet containers should make finding the root cause on such
occasions easier.

Change-Id: I2ea197673b470379ead295058b6952cce3a69606
Closes-Bug: #1737954
(cherry picked from commit 51a3b05f4ec952d99935fdbbc64347c0404fd29b)

Thanks for your review. Backwards compatibility is important. But I don't think we need consider it here. Could you please give more details about backwards compatibility?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-02 10:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

 > Thanks for your review. Backwards compatibility is important. But I
 > don't think we need consider it here. Could you please give more
 > details about backwards compatibility?

My point was that because the disable_selinux variable has been removed, if the user had set that variable to False, the new defaults would change the behaviour, and apply the permissive policy.

One way to avoid that is to keep the disable_selinux variable, and use it set the defaults for the new variables, e.g.:

change_selinux: "{{ disable_selinux | default(True) | bool }}"
selinux_policy: permissive

I don't think it's a big issue for this feature.'}, {'account_id': 25167, 'date': '2018-02-03 09:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks for your review. According to http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/selinux_module.html,
 "target" is invalid value for selinux module.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-06 09:20:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > > I don't think this changed is necessary
 > >
 > > You can't just -1 a change saying it's not necessary. Please
 > > explain your reasoning.
 > 
 > Hi Mark, thanks for your notice,
 > The original is work and no warning message,  so it is not invaild
 > I think, and the change_selinux is true , means  the task will
 > always change the permissive to permissive, look strange,  disable
 > it is better for me.

The default behaviour here is the same as before this change - to set SELinux to permissive mode. What this change adds is the ability to do one of two other things:

1. Set change_selinux = False, and don't change the current SELinux config.
2. Set selinux_mode = <mode>, and change the SELinux mode. There are two other options - 'enforcing', and 'disabled'. Each is useful in different cases. Sometimes permissive is undesirable because the audit log can fill up with SELinux policy violations."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-06 09:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Update task about selinux set.

1.Fix the invalid value about selinux policy
2.Update description of task about selinux.The permissive mode
need enable selinux.The parameter named "disable_selinux" is not good.
In order to customize selinux modes, we need a new
parameter named "selinux_state".

Closes-Bug: #1749046
Change-Id: I20c084cf2e46cc0de149afbd34c6dcb77a1051f4

commit_message:
Use apt Ansible module instead of apt-get to update cache

Ansible recommends to use apt module instead of apt-get.
This patch fixes install.yml and pre-install.yml accordingly.

Change-Id: I3241ce332e7cf522786e78280643440a30a23875
Closes-Bug: #1747436

commit_message:
Add default for undercloud_rpm_dependencies

I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8 removed
the default value of undercloud_rpm_dependencies causing
failures for jobs where the release files did not have
the variable overridden.

This review places the default in the extras-common role.

Change-Id: Iefd79b80a757af5ab05168892baeb68a7ab4efba

commit_message:
Document 'post' job names

Some may consider it confusing that most jobs on zuul.openstack.org are
named after their review numbers, but `post` jobs aren't.  This change
adds words to the description of the post queue indicating that jobs are
named after the abbreviated version of the commit hash of the merge.

Change-Id: I8a304b302d13468f6cbb73edadf60c6667ec32e3

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 07:32:37.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0bfd40fcfab35aedb13d071336232aaa26f86fb9
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0bfd40fcfab35aedb13d071336232aaa26f86fb9

commit_message:
Add volumes to MapR default templates

MapR requires volumes in order to be deployed properly and the
default templates do not include them.  This patch fixes it so
they have a default volume.

Change-Id: I7e8e96a2bcbc510dc9d6eb43e2d1f61979be6d03
Related-Bug: #1442545
Related-Bug: #1439433

commit_message:
eventlet workaround to avoid import cycle issue

Do get_hub() before monkey_patch() to workaround issue with
import cycles in eventlet < 0.22.0;
Based on the worked-around in eventlet with patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Also moved monkey_patch() up as far as possible to make sure all imports
get patched modules.

Closes-Bug: 1746136
Closes-Bug: 1745112

Conceptually cherry-picked from change I72c349e81dfc02136b22637c707ad4908c9f269e

Change-Id: I0ed736f30f8fd7a3ec046e5810b84b52910fa4c9

commit_message:
eventlet workaround to avoid import cycle issue

Do get_hub() before monkey_patch() to workaround issue with
import cycles in eventlet < 0.22.0;
Based on the worked-around in eventlet with patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Also moved monkey_patch() up as far as possible to make sure all imports
get patched modules.

Closes-Bug: 1746136
Closes-Bug: 1745112

Conceptually cherry-picked from change I72c349e81dfc02136b22637c707ad4908c9f269e

Change-Id: I0ed736f30f8fd7a3ec046e5810b84b52910fa4c9

commit_message:
Add support for multiple playbooks

Update the ceph-ansible workbook so that the $.ceph_ansible_playbook
parameter may also be a list of playbooks. This change is done without
breaking backwards compatability so that if the parameter is passed as
a string which represents a single playbook, then only that playbook is
executed.

Change-Id: I70786ab7b81f9985ddf1148b14ef803c327752b9

[{'created': '2018-02-12 20:51:48.000000000', 'message': "Use configured value for import-methods header

In Image API v2.6, the image-create response returns an
'OpenStack-image-import-methods' header containing a list of
methods available in that cloud.  This patch populates that
list from the enabled_import_methods configuration setting.
Following RFC 7230, if the enabled_import_methods is empty,
the header is not returned with the response.

Change-Id: I3066da36a0fbb83fe492bddb193975e42ffc5084
Closes-bug: #1748559
(cherry picked from commit 3712dccfdb7ee30243e4efc09fcad1c3197bdb51)
"}]
commit_message:
Use configured value for import-methods header

In Image API v2.6, the image-create response returns an
'OpenStack-image-import-methods' header containing a list of
methods available in that cloud.  This patch populates that
list from the enabled_import_methods configuration setting.
Following RFC 7230, if the enabled_import_methods is empty,
the header is not returned with the response.

Change-Id: I3066da36a0fbb83fe492bddb193975e42ffc5084
Closes-bug: #1748559
(cherry picked from commit 3712dccfdb7ee30243e4efc09fcad1c3197bdb51)

Fix broken unit tests

DB validations need to make sure that the value is True or False.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ifb59d3ea129d35e06565fd4afc3fddd49f86aa32

[{'created': '2018-02-09 10:06:07.000000000', 'message': 'Offline migration support for postgresql

After recent change in manage command [1]
deploying glance with postgres using stack.sh
fails as db_sync internally uses E-M-C and it
has support only for mysql.

Made provision to perform offline migration
if database is postgresql.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Change-Id: Ie6c66da8b26930d783526a4b92b77baf493825f9
Closes-Bug: #bug/1747869
'}]
commit_message:
Offline migration support for postgresql

After recent change in manage command [1]
deploying glance with postgres using stack.sh
fails as db_sync internally uses E-M-C and it
has support only for mysql.

Made provision to perform offline migration
if database is postgresql.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Change-Id: Ie6c66da8b26930d783526a4b92b77baf493825f9
Closes-Bug: #bug/1747869

commit_message:
Auto compute node registration

This patch adds the automatic host registration function.
The monitors register their own hostname to the specified
failover segment  when they start up.

Change-Id: I650a313ef0e86f4044c6150524bbeff96221e3ad
Implements: bp auto-compute-node-registration

commit_message:
Fix a race condition with execution creation

During the pagination test two workflows are created in quick
succession. If this happens within the same second then the order wont
always be the creation order.

This change bases the order on how they were returned in the original
execution-list output.

Change-Id: Ibd93dfe5257bc601515a06f5fb45dd7ab82a5618

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 14:08:26.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for worker start before testing in JournalPeriodicProcessorTest

These tests are susceptible to a race condition:
  - JournalPeriodicProcessorTest.test_handle_sighup_gracefully
  - JournalPeriodicProcessorTest.test_reset_called_on_sighup

The race condition happens when the worker is SIGHUP before both the signal
processing is registered and the worker is started. In that case there
is no handle by the IPC set by the mock and therefore the testing
process timeouts waiting for the event to happen.

This patch removes the time element from the test by making it event
based.

Change-Id: Ie5310bd026f29e2a5b61eaa1109fb051e09b3258
'}, {'created': '2018-01-29 14:11:03.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for worker start before testing in JournalPeriodicProcessorTest

These tests are susceptible to a race condition:
  - JournalPeriodicProcessorTest.test_handle_sighup_gracefully
  - JournalPeriodicProcessorTest.test_reset_called_on_sighup

The race condition happens when the worker is SIGHUP before both the signal
processing is registered and the worker is started. In that case there
is no handle by the IPC set by the mock and therefore the testing
process timeouts waiting for the event to happen.

This patch removes the time element from the test by making it event
based.

Change-Id: Ie5310bd026f29e2a5b61eaa1109fb051e09b3258
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for worker start before testing in JournalPeriodicProcessorTest

These tests are susceptible to a race condition:
  - JournalPeriodicProcessorTest.test_handle_sighup_gracefully
  - JournalPeriodicProcessorTest.test_reset_called_on_sighup

The race condition happens when the worker is SIGHUP before both the signal
processing is registered and the worker is started. In that case there
is no handle by the IPC set by the mock and therefore the testing
process timeouts waiting for the event to happen.

This patch removes the time element from the test by making it event
based.

Change-Id: Ie5310bd026f29e2a5b61eaa1109fb051e09b3258

commit_message:
Make sure selinux permissions are correct on ~/.ssh.

It may happen that if the environment is switched from Not enforcing
to enforcing, the permissions of the ~/.ssh directory are selinux
wrong making the undercloud unreachable.

Added fix from Ib5873383632a1141c8dd3859b34ca29904020790

Change-Id: Ifc76d3717f4f214f9f3d55ccbafdbcc0180c31c1
Closes-Bug: #1711564
(cherry picked from commit 8808f92b6c3d09b4d6aaf563543bfc395a77abdc)

commit_message:
Remove branches filter from jobs

As each branch will have their own zuul definitions this will be get
updated for new branches that are cut. In the future new branches won't
have jobs that aren't needed.

Change-Id: I8ba7e0914f200f4b4e80c1f9010d6113ada56317

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I96b4c3fd20d72834d7dfbf52d9d4c5df259c3b52

commit_message:
Cleanup test-requirements

python-subunit is not used directly anywhere
and it is dependency of both testrepository
and os-testr
(probably was used by some tox wrapper script before)

Change-Id: Iee644bd52b4a0e2cd7157a7cc750e9bdb46686b2

commit_message:
Add support for upgrade instance

Added a row menu action for upgrade instance only if there are
multiple datastore versions for the instance datastore.

The action will bring up a dialog showing the current version
and a dropdown listing all the datastore versions (with the
current version filterd out of the list).

Added a new trove api for instance_upgrade.

Change-Id: I0257d1650da870931f4324554f1039f7582af74f
Closes-Bug: #1648883

[{'created': '2018-02-09 16:35:14.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I192d4350aea8a4a3bd029d378c64f207b5082f0d
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I192d4350aea8a4a3bd029d378c64f207b5082f0d

Add Notification Panel

- List view of all notifications (will be split into acknowleged and
  unacknowledged)
- Detail view of each notification
- Acknowledge notifications
- Error notifications show up in red

commit_message:
Fix an issue on populating the pause state

If the docker container is in 'pause' state, the periodic task
will populate the container status as 'Unknown' which is incorrect.

Change-Id: I691a941869087fd87ff8deac29fd91b0f51230eb
(cherry picked from commit 165405925bc8008696566c5b2eeceb212ce56932)

commit_message:
exception-handling-error-in-network-attach

Attach the same network to the container, the error log is
2018-02-09 17:31:06.811 43376 ERROR zun.compute.manager
TypeError: 'Container' object has no attribute '__getitem__'

this patch fix it

Closes-Bug: #1748335

Yes, these use legacy scripts and need a legacy job as parent until they are reworked as native jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-12 20:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-12 20:25:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-12 20:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 01:09:48.000000000', 'message': 'Reparent tripleo-buildimage-* to tripleo-ci-dsvm

All these jobs use "base" as the parent; but for example
tripleo-buildimage-overcloud-full-centos-7 calls
install-distro-packages.sh which is now copied in by jobs, rather than
being in the image [1]

I think these want to parent to tripleo-ci-dsvm, which parents to
legacy-dsvm-bsae, which will install scripts such as this correctly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542649/

Change-Id: I61d7d80929e913402ecb62cc44f8bd3101ff5784
'}]
commit_message:
Reparent tripleo-buildimage-* to tripleo-ci-dsvm

All these jobs use "base" as the parent; but for example
tripleo-buildimage-overcloud-full-centos-7 calls
install-distro-packages.sh which is now copied in by jobs, rather than
being in the image [1]

I think these want to parent to tripleo-ci-dsvm, which parents to
legacy-dsvm-bsae, which will install scripts such as this correctly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542649/

Change-Id: I61d7d80929e913402ecb62cc44f8bd3101ff5784

commit_message:
Include barbican modules to swift proxy

Including new modules to be deployed with the Swift proxy
These new modules enable barbican support in Swift

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/525321
Change-Id: I1ceda973733acb081967ab04a5fd57eb1609c9a7
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-29 11:12:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-29 11:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The only Kolla image that contains the L2GW service plugin is:

https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/docker/neutron/neutron-server-opendaylight/Dockerfile.j2

If I want to apply puppet configuration to more than one container, do I have to create a docker service per container???'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-01-29 13:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> If I want to apply puppet configuration to more than one container, do I have to create a docker service per container???

A docker service could host multiple containers.'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-01-29 20:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Base neutron-server container at the moment is meant to only house core neutron bits.  Advanced feature plugins like L2GW are included in the SDN related neutron kolla containers.  I would leave that alone for now, keep this generic, but test with the ODL neutron server container.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-31 09:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the IRC discussion. Updating the discussion in here for reference:

As I understand, enabling L2GW requires a set of configurations generated by puppet to be available for the neutron-server. So for your case, you just need to ensure that puppet data is generated when the L2GW is enabled, by adding a docker service with just puppet-config, which will write the configs to the same config_volume 'neutron'.

And as stated in earlier patch, the parameters need to be merged using the config_settings from the puppet/service, rather than adding again on docker/service."}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-01-31 11:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-02-01 17:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-02-02 11:28:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

From what I can tell, this will only trigger a configuration container... and that's it. Is this intended?"}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-02-02 11:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-02-05 05:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Adding docker service for the L2GW

  L2GW Neutron driver is only present in neutron-server-opendaylight
  image. This service will apply its configuration to that image,
  but it should be extensible to other containers such neutron-server
  in the future.

Depends-On: I22023a645c4752c6371b5cea5ab69c7503991887
Change-Id: I9c39e9ff2ce2e15d3e383035c8cac7413e9eeb03
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Noriega <rnoriega@redhat.com>

subject: bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-12 10:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 10:16:41.000000000', 'message': "bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043 and
implements a more targeted solution.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
the task to enable swap is now fully idempotent too, so the reason
for the initial implementation is also solved.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
(cherry picked from commit aad094549ecacd1c1f9217e6bfa4286213b4b36e)
"}]
commit_message:
bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043 and
implements a more targeted solution.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
the task to enable swap is now fully idempotent too, so the reason
for the initial implementation is also solved.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
(cherry picked from commit aad094549ecacd1c1f9217e6bfa4286213b4b36e)

commit_message:
Add bond-network-templates for OVB public bond CI

te-broker can set up an OVB stack to deploy the overcloud
with public bond network isolation but the heat templates
used in the overcloud deployment were missing.

This review adds these templates from openstack-virtual-baremetal
so that public bond network isolation can be tested in CI.

Change-Id: Ied543e70491ff85d6fab4371812bca802c6b1032

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 20:26:36.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8a9b5ed4273dd42bddbbb301540260f72cfb7d1f
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8a9b5ed4273dd42bddbbb301540260f72cfb7d1f

subject: Fix mariadb@bootstrap.service systemd unit
messages:
[{'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-06 17:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-06 17:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-07 04:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Guys, anybody has a suggestion about this change ?'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-02-12 05:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi, Gaetan, thanks for this and sorry for the late review. I couldn't find out why this behavior is changed by the upstream MariaDB team [1], it just seems like a simple development decision. As for Trove guestagent, I'd prefer not changing the DIB elements, but do this in the guestagent, because people may not always use images built by the DIB elements from trove/integration. We could detect whether the 'galera_new_cluster' exists, then decide how we bootstrap cluster accordingly[2].

[1] https://github.com/MariaDB/server/commit/a2c3549404cbdc55aaaa8537739853d7369aa79a#diff-69c2c819ad6db126245fc3aeafd68077

[2] https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/mariadb/service.py#L51-L55"}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Zhao, no problem for the late review !

I was thinking about changing the code but how are we sure that the galera_new_cluster command will have the same path across distributions ?

I can work on a draft :)

Thanks for your feedback !'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:22:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-02-13 01:28:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> @Zhao, no problem for the late review !
 > 
 > I was thinking about changing the code but how are we sure that the
 > galera_new_cluster command will have the same path across
 > distributions ?
 > 
 > I can work on a draft :)
 > 
 > Thanks for your feedback !

For determining the location of 'galera_new_cluster', as currently only Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS are supported by most OpenStack services, so I think it would be fine to just search where 'galera_new_cluster' is installed under theses distributions. Otherwise we could searching the command under the common binary directories like '/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin', I think this should also be sufficient."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 17:35:11.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix mariadb@bootstrap.service systemd unit

The way how Trove is spawning Galera cluster with
MariaDB 10.1 and systemd is not working anymore.
In MariaDB 10.1 the mariadb@bootstrap.service
systemd unit file is deprecated.

MariaDB recommends to use "galera_new_cluster"
command to bootstrap a Galera cluster.

The fix consists to make mariadb@bootstrap.service
uses galera_new_cluster command.

Change-Id: I79b24bd909fb5211a6a70942e8362654465bf7fb
Closes-Bug: #1747475
'}, {'created': '2018-02-06 17:39:54.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix mariadb@bootstrap.service systemd unit

The way how Trove is spawning Galera cluster with
MariaDB 10.1 and systemd is not working anymore.
In MariaDB 10.1 the mariadb@bootstrap.service
systemd unit file is deprecated.

MariaDB recommends to use "galera_new_cluster"

commit_message:
Fix mariadb@bootstrap.service systemd unit

The way how Trove is spawning Galera cluster with
MariaDB 10.1 and systemd is not working anymore.
In MariaDB 10.1 the mariadb@bootstrap.service
systemd unit file is deprecated.

MariaDB recommends to use "galera_new_cluster"
command to bootstrap a Galera cluster.

The fix consists to make mariadb@bootstrap.service
uses galera_new_cluster command.

Change-Id: I79b24bd909fb5211a6a70942e8362654465bf7fb
Closes-Bug: #1747475

[{'created': '2018-02-09 13:45:29.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I7725b1eaa1def4b05cc6043d272dd9ebde3401e8
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I7725b1eaa1def4b05cc6043d272dd9ebde3401e8

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 14:38:44.000000000', 'message': "k8s: Fix kubelet, add RBAC and pass e2e tests

Due to a few several small connected patches for the
fedora atomic driver, this patch includes 4 smaller patches.

Patch 1:
k8s: Do not start kubelet and kube-proxy on master

Patch [1], misses the removal of kubelet and kube-proxy from
enable-services-master.sh and therefore they are started if they
exist in the image or the script will fail.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533593/
Closes-Bug: #1726482

Patch 2:
k8s: Set require-kubeconfig when needed

From kubernetes 1.8 [1] --require-kubeconfig is deprecated and
in kubernetes 1.9 it is removed.

Add --require-kubeconfig only for k8s <= 1.8.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36745

Closes-Bug: #1718926

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534309/

Patch 3:
k8s_fedora: Add RBAC configuration

* Make certificates and kubeconfigs compatible
  with NodeAuthorizer [1].
* Add CoreDNS roles and rolebindings.
* Create the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole.
* Bind the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole to
  the kubernetes user.
* remove creation of kube-system namespaces, it is created
  by default
* do not enable kubelet and kube-proxy services on master
  (done here, because after enabling rbac is becoming a
   real issue since before kubelet was starting but it
   cound not register with the apiserver)

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authorization/node/

Depends-On: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527103/

Patch 4:
k8s_fedora: Update coredns config to pass e2e

To pass the e2e conformance tests, coredns needs to
be configured with POD-MODE verified. Otherwise, pods
won't be resolvable [1].

[1] https://github.com/coredns/coredns/tree/master/plugin/kubernetes

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528566/
Closes-Bug: #1738633

Change-Id: Ibd5245ca0f5a11e1d67a2514cebb2ffe8aa5e7de
"}, {'created': '2018-01-17 14:52:46.000000000', 'message': "k8s: Fix kubelet, add RBAC and pass e2e tests

* Add CoreDNS roles and rolebindings.
* Create the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole.
* Bind the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole to
  the kubernetes user.
* remove creation of kube-system namespaces, it is created
  by default
* do not enable kubelet and kube-proxy services on master
  (done here, because after enabling rbac is becoming a
   real issue since before kubelet was starting but it
   cound not register with the apiserver)

Closes-Bug: #1738633

* remove creation of kube-system namespaces, it is created
  by default
* update client cert generation in the conductor with
  kubernetes' requirements
* Add --insecure-bind-address=127.0.0.1 to work on
  multi-master too. The controller manager on each
  node needs to contact the apiserver (on the same node)
  on 127.0.0.1:8080

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authorization/node/

Closes-Bug: #1742420
Depends-On: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527103/

Patch 4:
k8s_fedora: Update coredns config to pass e2e

To pass the e2e conformance tests, coredns needs to
be configured with POD-MODE verified. Otherwise, pods
won't be resolvable [1].

[1] https://github.com/coredns/coredns/tree/master/plugin/kubernetes

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528566/
Closes-Bug: #1738633

Change-Id: Ibd5245ca0f5a11e1d67a2514cebb2ffe8aa5e7de

commit_message:
k8s: Fix kubelet, add RBAC and pass e2e tests

Due to a few several small connected patches for the
fedora atomic driver, this patch includes 4 smaller patches.

Patch 1:
k8s: Do not start kubelet and kube-proxy on master

Patch [1], misses the removal of kubelet and kube-proxy from
enable-services-master.sh and therefore they are started if they
exist in the image or the script will fail.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533593/
Closes-Bug: #1726482

Patch 2:
k8s: Set require-kubeconfig when needed

From kubernetes 1.8 [1] --require-kubeconfig is deprecated and
in kubernetes 1.9 it is removed.

Add --require-kubeconfig only for k8s <= 1.8.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36745

Closes-Bug: #1718926

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534309/

Patch 3:
k8s_fedora: Add RBAC configuration

* Make certificates and kubeconfigs compatible
  with NodeAuthorizer [1].
* Add CoreDNS roles and rolebindings.
* Create the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole.
* Bind the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole to
  the kubernetes user.
* remove creation of kube-system namespaces, it is created
  by default
* update client cert generation in the conductor with
  kubernetes' requirements
* Add --insecure-bind-address=127.0.0.1 to work on
  multi-master too. The controller manager on each
  node needs to contact the apiserver (on the same node)
  on 127.0.0.1:8080

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authorization/node/

Closes-Bug: #1742420
Depends-On: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527103/

Patch 4:
k8s_fedora: Update coredns config to pass e2e

To pass the e2e conformance tests, coredns needs to
be configured with POD-MODE verified. Otherwise, pods
won't be resolvable [1].

[1] https://github.com/coredns/coredns/tree/master/plugin/kubernetes

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528566/
Closes-Bug: #1738633

Change-Id: Ibd5245ca0f5a11e1d67a2514cebb2ffe8aa5e7de

subject: Clarifications to image tag discovery section
messages:
[{'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:41:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-02-08 20:21:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This isn't working for me:

$ openstack overcloud container image tag discover \
>       --image trunk.registry.rdoproject.org/master/centos-binary-base:current-tripleo-rdo \
>       --tag-from-label current-tripleo-rdo
Image trunk.registry.rdoproject.org/master/centos-binary-base:current-tripleo-rdo has no label current-tripleo-rdo. Available labels: build_id, maintainer, name, license, rdo_version, kolla_version, vendor, build-date

Oddly enough, the original command _is_ working now, although it's returning a bunch of tags and it's not clear which one to use:

$ openstack overcloud container image tag discover       --image trunk.registry.rdoproject.org/master/centos-binary-base:current-tripleo-rdo       --tag-from-label rdo_version
Image trunk.registry.rdoproject.org/master/centos-binary-base:current-tripleo-rdo has no tag 3b85715c6488a692fcdf4e4c6a589d77c60eb5a6_a3792c8d.

commit_message:
Only run openstack tox jobs on ara master branch

Currently feature/1.0 branch runs these jobs but overrides them as
non-voting. Which is fine for check pipelines, but wastes resources in
gate.  For now, only run these jobs on master and have feature/1.0
branch manage which jobs run there.

Change-Id: I90c304be46bb20eebd43ecd4fd1cb94b234ed784
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

It has problems with linters: http://logs.openstack.org/77/539377/1/check/openstack-tox-linters/4106bf7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-31_00_36_36_698988'}, {'account_id': 21686, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21686, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

left some comments in line. I understand if the point is just to move the script as is - will remove my -1'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

note few in line comments'}, {'account_id': 21686, 'date': '2018-02-01 03:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@rlandy per discussion afaik the plan is:

a.) existing script (with its warts) --> upstream
b.) create internal trigger on this script (rdo2, virthost, sbtest)
c.) iterate with CI validating changes to the script.

I agree with the changes you propose (and making this better generally) but would prefer to get proper CI on this script and iterate using CI / automated validation if possible.

Alternately I can make these changes but will need to test them by hand first, please advise.

Thanks!

Matt'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

ok - so removing -1 - understanding that the changes will be made on following reviews'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks for putting this up!'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ps.: the gates that failed are not relevant here, they are not using this script.'}]

* Turned off by default but can be configured

Implements: blueprint octavia-quota-service

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I35e6f2877f1614610dc4452bf7261078a3ac2347

subject: kube.sh: fix wrong systemd mount flag
messages: [{'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-02-12 03:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-02-12 22:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 03:54:55.000000000', 'message': 'kube.sh: fix wrong systemd mount flag

When customize docker systemd service, the value of MountFlags should be
"shared" rather than "share" [1].

[1] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.exec.html#MountFlags=

Change-Id: I435ab65db521edfda1ee784122f68d93ce6c9dda
'}]
commit_message:
kube.sh: fix wrong systemd mount flag

When customize docker systemd service, the value of MountFlags should be
"shared" rather than "share" [1].

[1] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.exec.html#MountFlags=

Change-Id: I435ab65db521edfda1ee784122f68d93ce6c9dda

commit_message:
Add pycrypto to blacklist

This patch set adds pyCrypto to bandit's blacklist, so bandit will
strongly advise against using pyCrypto. As mentioned in the bug,
this may cause false positives if people use pyCrytodome, but will be
tracked and addressed in follow up patch set.

Depends-On: I0b1a90c3a47ad6d3b18597e5315e9f017854a146
Change-Id: I81f695cd31dee393ab4530dbcdb20dd925bbece2
Closes-Bug: #1655973

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic0e86b628be212576aed5f13d370d1da6dfee556

commit_message:
Adds configuration for SSL OVSDB connections

Exposes new parameters to configure SSL key, certificate, and CA
certificate files.  This allows DHCP agent to connect to OVSDB using
SSL.  Also the OVS/ovsdb_connection configuration was previously in ODL
ML2 class, which should have been in the DHCP agent to begin with as it
is not ML2 configuration.  This patch deprecates the previous behavior
and adds ovsdb_connection into DHCP agent to use its normal service
default.

Partial-Bug: 1746762

Depends-On: I19fd9dd0c72260835eb91e557a6029ec9d652179

Change-Id: I82281eefa1aa81207ccd8ea565cffc6ca0ec48de
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

branch ansible. This is normal for the infrastructure bits (which
are running on current branch), but not for the installation of

commit_message:
Use a venv with previous ansible version for upgrades

When doing the role upgrade, we run every playbook with current's
branch ansible. This is normal for the infrastructure bits (which
are running on current branch), but not for the installation of
the previous branch's role, which should use previous branch's
environment. This script already exists for some OSA roles to
facilitate upgrades but we are now moving it to the tests
repository so all roles can benefit from it.

(Original patch 91b7524603650edbef984fd9fe83e352b90604d2)
Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/34790
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Closes-Bug: #1741471

Change-Id: I7ebb045885dd645b820de2b7f75b46c755c015f6
(cherry picked from commit f51a22988de85e44b122af8046eedc396de98032)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 13:24:58.000000000', 'message': "Don't install puppetlabs repo when MANAGE_REPOS=false

Currently, p-o-i allways tries to install puppet package
from puppetlabs repo. In some cases, as RDO-CI we use p-o-i
to test puppet modules from RDO distro and it's recommended
to test it using puppet version provided in RDO repos which
uses different paths.

This patch provides a way to override this behavior by using
env variables as:

MANAGE_REPOS=false
PUPPET_PKG=puppet
PUPPETFILE_DIR=/etc/puppet/modules

Change-Id: I680504ab65d780deba53387e9b6604d3102de47b
(cherry picked from commit 2887c1652f955db8cf474a4f3d20223f1c790cae)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install puppetlabs repo when MANAGE_REPOS=false

Currently, p-o-i allways tries to install puppet package
from puppetlabs repo. In some cases, as RDO-CI we use p-o-i
to test puppet modules from RDO distro and it's recommended
to test it using puppet version provided in RDO repos which
uses different paths.

This patch provides a way to override this behavior by using
env variables as:

MANAGE_REPOS=false
PUPPET_PKG=puppet
PUPPETFILE_DIR=/etc/puppet/modules

Change-Id: I680504ab65d780deba53387e9b6604d3102de47b
(cherry picked from commit 2887c1652f955db8cf474a4f3d20223f1c790cae)

commit_message:
eventlet workaround to avoid import cycle issue

Do get_hub() before monkey_patch() to workaround issue with
import cycles in eventlet < 0.22.0;
Based on the worked-around in eventlet with patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Closes-Bug: 1746136
Closes-Bug: 1745112

Conceptually cherry-picked from change: I72c349e81dfc02136b22637c707ad4908c9f269e

Change-Id: I6743d240e8657c75aa2f6f64a22bcbacfdf023fd

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I075d708e115136fec26d6cdf0257d01c74266654

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I7b0ba9680557ded6db8e1bdbe18200a867f4b0b4
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I8fd31e28981863f582c00ccfe823950bb08ba0cf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Any updates here?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-06 04:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Tony, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522990 is where the work is happening that fixes the critical bug

The work there is almost done.

I suppose you should be taking a look to see if the stuff in that patch is okay with regards to the stable-branch policy. I hope it is, but if it's not I'm happy to split the patch into two parts"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-09 00:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-09 00:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Uhm, how do we fix  the error below? Is it enough to change the definition of the jobs in project-config for sahara-dashboard?

2018-02-09 00:45:51.846524 | ubuntu-xenial | deliverables/pike/sahara.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/sahara-dashboard, one of ['release-openstack-server', 'publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in ['system-required', 'check-requirements', 'openstack-python-jobs-horizon', 'openstack-python35-jobs-horizon', 'translation-jobs', 'translation-jobs-ocata', 'translation-jobs-pike', 'release-notes-jobs', 'publish-to-pypi-horizon'] or no release will be published
2018-02-09 00:45:51.846650 | ubuntu-xenial | deliverables/pike/sahara.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml has unexpected release jobs ['publish-to-pypi-horizon'] for release-type horizon but openstack/sahara-dashboard uses release-type python-service"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-09 01:11:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Aww rats :(

So If I understand correctly you can't just update project-config as that will cause the publish-jobs to fail (because you need horizon to be installed but it isn't (can't be) listed in requirements.txt.

publish-to-pypi-horizon is a valid release type for deliverables of type horizon ... but as there is a single release type per file we can't do that today. 

So I think the correct solution is to:

1. Create a change in openstack/governance to make sahara-dashboard it's own deliverable (akin to sahara-tests)

2. remove sahara-dashbord from sahara.yaml and create sahara-dashboard.yaml and be sure to set the type to horizon"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-09 06:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-09 19:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We have patch splitting the releases for queens, should it be backported, or I request just the split for sahara-dashboard for pike?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-12 01:59:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

deliverables/pike/sahara-dashboard.yaml: Initial releases in a series must increment at least the minor version or be beta versions. '7.0.1'

So the tooling cannot see the previous dashboard releases... I assume that's because of the change in deliverable type (and crucially not only because we've split out into multiple yaml files)

Even if there happens to be a way to push this through without adjusting the tooling, probably some enhancements to the tooling should be made anyway to avoid this in the future."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-12 05:34:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> deliverables/pike/sahara-dashboard.yaml: Initial releases in a
 > series must increment at least the minor version or be beta
 > versions. '7.0.1'
 > 
 > So the tooling cannot see the previous dashboard releases... I
 > assume that's because of the change in deliverable type (and
 > crucially not only because we've split out into multiple yaml
 > files)
 > 
 > Even if there happens to be a way to push this through without
 > adjusting the tooling, probably some enhancements to the tooling
 > should be made anyway to avoid this in the future.

I think the correct fix is import the 7.0.0 information in the the new deliverable file.  Longer term we'll need to do this for all deliverables in all current releases but we can do that later"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-12 05:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-12 05:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me.

Not approving as I wont be online to watch for failures'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Workflow -Code-Review

Not sure how this passed validation in check.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

What happened now? Is there anything that we can fix?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:39:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The issue is there are different release types included in one deliverable file. This appears to have been fixed in queens by splitting these out to separate deliverables, but those changes were never brought back to pike or ocata deliverables.

I can correct this so these releases will work, but like Tony pointed out, the history should probably be fixed up at some point.

Still not sure how it passed original check validation, but that's something for me to dig into later."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:46:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I can't speak for Telles but I'm pretty sure that he would agree with me that we agree with any solution that you want to have implemented, as long as we can get the release out and prevent future problems :)"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I can't speak for Telles but I'm pretty sure that he would agree
 > with me that we agree with any solution that you want to have
 > implemented, as long as we can get the release out and prevent
 > future problems :)

You are 100% right Luigi, thanks"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:50:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

;)

Let's see how this one goes."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

A couple libs included here, but since they are not tracked in openstack/requirements I believe this is OK.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
[placement] annotate loadapp as public interface

When Change-Id: I61d20c5d19797f7e66648c7864a632f3328be8ce was under
review there were questions about why the interface on deploy() was not
changed to remove the no-longer used project_name kwarg. I mistakenly
asserted that this was because it was a public interface for building
a Placement WSGI application. That's not the case. loadapp() is the
public interface.

This change annotates loadapp() as such, and removes the unused arg
deploy().

Change-Id: I9f3d03d964654ab1b9515ecd6fe35c518d5f496a
Related-Bug: #1734491

messages: [{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-08 23:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23140, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-02-09 19:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-02-12 17:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nThanks Colleen!'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-12 19:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 23:20:44.000000000', 'message': "Delete SQL users before deleting domain

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by adding a new internal
notification to alert the identity manager that users should be deleted.
This uses a new notification rather than the existing notification
because the existing one is used to alert listeners that the domain
deletion has been fully completed, whereas this one must happen in the
middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose this bug in our unit tests, but
there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
(cherry picked from commit 62ee18b359cbb2e6a9469bdaac9057ef19de1bdf)
"}]
commit_message:
Delete SQL users before deleting domain

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by adding a new internal
notification to alert the identity manager that users should be deleted.
This uses a new notification rather than the existing notification
because the existing one is used to alert listeners that the domain
deletion has been fully completed, whereas this one must happen in the
middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose this bug in our unit tests, but
there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
(cherry picked from commit 62ee18b359cbb2e6a9469bdaac9057ef19de1bdf)

commit_message:
Use configured value for import-methods header

In Image API v2.6, the image-create response returns an
'OpenStack-image-import-methods' header containing a list of
methods available in that cloud.  This patch populates that
list from the enabled_import_methods configuration setting.
Following RFC 7230, if the enabled_import_methods is empty,
the header is not returned with the response.

Change-Id: I3066da36a0fbb83fe492bddb193975e42ffc5084
Closes-bug: #1748559

subject: Update root with shard's own shard range even once sharded
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-02-07 11:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 11:05:22.000000000', 'message': "Update root with shard's own shard range even once sharded

Once a shard has sharded, it must update the root to indicate that
it's own shard range is deleted and the sub-shards are now
active. Before this happened when cleaving completed, but if those
requests failed then there was no further attempt.

Now, repeatedly update root even when shard has been sharded, to be
sure the root gets the state changes. This restores behaviour removed
in [1], but retains the update at completion of cleaving which is
timely in case the shard then remains in sharding state.

Note that each repeated update uses same timestamp so updates will be
idempotent.

[1] Related-Change: I0aa2e2b077cd3ae1fc73985051c0302230f5c603

Change-Id: Ied777f7dfa35e790d9cae664f7fc1330854a7660
"}]
commit_message:
Update root with shard's own shard range even once sharded

Once a shard has sharded, it must update the root to indicate that
it's own shard range is deleted and the sub-shards are now
active. Before this happened when cleaving completed, but if those
requests failed then there was no further attempt.

Now, repeatedly update root even when shard has been sharded, to be
sure the root gets the state changes. This restores behaviour removed
in [1], but retains the update at completion of cleaving which is
timely in case the shard then remains in sharding state.

Note that each repeated update uses same timestamp so updates will be
idempotent.

[1] Related-Change: I0aa2e2b077cd3ae1fc73985051c0302230f5c603

Change-Id: Ied777f7dfa35e790d9cae664f7fc1330854a7660

commit_message:
Fix merge_shard_ranges to preserve existing bounds when created_at is equal

When merging a new shard range with existing, if the created_at timestamps
are equal then the lower and upper bounds of the existing should always be
kept.

Before, the bounds of the new item might be merged if the new item also had
metadata or state changes at newer meta or state timestamps.

Change-Id: I221ac287b794b955c9f5def7034187c00a37586e

commit_message:
Disable pypi permission verification

Issues seen with validating openstack/requirements permissions
while attempting to branch. For now, just disable the check
until a better point in the cycle to troubleshoot.

Change-Id: If753f872ad519edb9bbf6631b17f4a0ada88fce2

commit_message:
Improve the RecordSet Update UI

This adds the logic introduced in
I8fefd9d0f104170d50c5d5dc3cbcc53facda9baf to the "recordset set"
command as well.

This helps with the consistancy, and fixes some of the same issues
in the set command.

Change-Id: Ib943ed0eea436ad1a7ad0c3717f0fb6bd6b5b3f0

This patch changes the use of systemctl via the command module
over to the Ansible systemd module.

One conditional check for systemd was removed since all supported
distributions deployed by OSA have systemd.

Change-Id: I926e94d185f4999e13b33f7d035b9dd5cf732f0b
(cherry picked from commit ad29910e6c68a5ba09ee087c821302cd0af0ab0d)

commit_message:
Use systemd module instead of command

This patch changes the use of systemctl via the command module
over to the Ansible systemd module.

One conditional check for systemd was removed since all supported
distributions deployed by OSA have systemd.

Change-Id: I926e94d185f4999e13b33f7d035b9dd5cf732f0b
(cherry picked from commit ad29910e6c68a5ba09ee087c821302cd0af0ab0d)

commit_message:
Stop using the tripleoupstream docker.io namespace

tripleoupstream is unmaintained and docker.io/tripleomaster should be
used instead.
Note that the centos-binary-kolla-toolbox is *not* currently built in
that namespace.

Change-Id: Ib53c3d4a58b6f13509fd44ea2e36db046fec2369
