- gate-cinderclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/91/444591/1/check/gate-cinderclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv/d6745b2/ : FAILURE in 17m 47s (non-voting)
- gate-cinderclient-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/91/444591/1/check/gate-cinderclient-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/9bf90b3/ : FAILURE in 17m 37s (non-voting)
- gate-python-cinderclient-pylint-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/91/444591/1/check/gate-python-cinderclient-pylint-ubuntu-xenial/dca6c09/ : SUCCESS in 3m 45s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 7173, 'date': '2017-05-25 17:37:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

'cinder bash_completion' works just as 'cinder bash-completion' does. This is the common pattern for optional paramaters, to include both the dash and underline versions.
I'm not sure that is safe for all users to delete this."}, {'account_id': 21515, 'date': '2017-05-27 08:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> 'cinder bash_completion' works just as 'cinder bash-completion'
 > does. This is the common pattern for optional paramaters, to
 > include both the dash and underline versions.
 > I'm not sure that is safe for all users to delete this.

but i cannot find "bash_completion" in help information. and 

 > 'cinder bash_completion' works just as 'cinder bash-completion'
 > does. This is the common pattern for optional paramaters, to
 > include both the dash and underline versions.
 > I'm not sure that is safe for all users to delete this.

bash_completion cannot be found in cinder's help, and bash_complrtion call entry is code-written, but bash-completion call entry and help information are created automatically according to the "do_" rule. In order to better promote bash-completion and its rational use, i think the bash_completion should be deleted.'}, {'account_id': 7173, 'date': '2017-06-05 13:15:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Even if something is undocumented in the help, someone may be using it.
We cannot just remove something without deprecation.
IF you'd like, you could add the missing help entry.
Also, you could re-factor the code so that it worked like other commands that have both dash and underline versions."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2017-06-15 19:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2017-06-15 19:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And, "bash_completion" is not in the help on purpose.  It's not an end-user command, and we don't need to list both bash-completion and bash_completion in help.'}, {'account_id': 21515, 'date': '2017-07-04 01:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-09-08 16:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any updates?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 20:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
delete bash_completion in subcommand

There are two "completion" in the subcommand table: bash-completion
and bash_completion. but "bash_completion" is useless, so delete
it and extra code.

Change-Id: I65108576493e7fa28c0bf459129b6cc0999cf373
Closes-Bug: #1670123

commit_message:
Add boot from encrypted volume tests in addition to attach

This is essentially a duplicate of
Ifb193b17b8d13f7a6d280b12fffd3dc2feeb47c4 for the Barbican plugin
ensuring that we also test booting from an encrypted volume as the
codepaths differ greatly in the Nova's libvirt driver at present.

Change-Id: Ifc7b115864806081fb63771d1daacdf42dd1f928

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-13 06:19:59.000000000', 'message': 'Set the default machinectl limit to unlimited

when importing a container image we currently set the base image
capability to 16G which under some conditions may be too small. This
change sets the cache to "-" which disables the quota system by default
allowing the cache to grow as needed. If a deployer chooses to limit the
size of the machinectl backend they can by defining a value accordingly.
More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
option.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-14 02:15:07.000000000', 'message': 'Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow

when importing a container image we currently set the base image
capability to 16G which under some conditions may be too small. This
change sets the cache to "-" which disables the quota system by default
allowing the cache to grow as needed. If a deployer chooses to limit the
size of the machinectl backend they can by defining a value accordingly.
More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
option.

Because we support both modern and older systemd the cache prep tasks
for old systemd have been updated so that deployers using earlier
versions of systemd can benifit from this enhancement.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-14 03:00:44.000000000', 'message': 'Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow

The machinectl cache is currently set image to 16G by default. If
multiple container images are imported into the cache this may be too
small by default. This change sets the cache to "64G" by default allowing
the cache more room to grow by.

This change also disables the quota system once the limit has been set
when running on modern systemd environments. The option
`lxc_host_machine_quota_disabled` has been added to disable or enable
the quota system as needed. This is done after the default limit has
been set so an adequately sized sparce file can be created should it not
already exist.

> More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
  option.

Because we support both modern and older systemd, the cache prep tasks
for old systemd have been updated so that deployers using earlier
versions of systemd can benefit from the ability to grow an existing
cache via playbook run.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow

The machinectl cache is currently set image to 16G by default. If
multiple container images are imported into the cache this may be too
small by default. This change sets the cache to "64G" by default allowing
the cache more room to grow by.

This change also disables the quota system once the limit has been set
The option `lxc_host_machine_quota_disabled` has been added to disable or
enable the quota system as needed. This is done after the default limit has
been set so an adequately sized sparce file can be created should it not
already exist.

> More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
  option.

Because we support both modern and older systemd, the cache prep tasks
for old systemd have been updated so that deployers using earlier
versions of systemd can benefit from the ability to grow an existing
cache via playbook run.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Closes-Bug: #1745361
Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Really use imported Zuul jobs

Zuul only handles .yaml as file extension, so rename the file so that it
gets used.

Fix the file so that tests work:
* Add kolla-kubernetes-base, it was missing here.
* Fix path of playbooks.
* Remove extra "---" and project name since it's not needed anymore (the
  scripted change does not catch this, since it's an invalid file).
* Use legacy nodesets.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/540670
Change-Id: I0320fc692a26ba2f4c973eaeef9d2df9d9fde536

commit_message:
Add bond-network-templates for OVB public bond CI

te-broker can set up an OVB stack to deploy the overcloud
with public bond network isolation but the heat templates
used in the overcloud deployment were missing.

This review adds these templates from openstack-virtual-baremetal
so that public bond network isolation can be tested in CI.

Change-Id: Ied543e70491ff85d6fab4371812bca802c6b1032

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I7b8cb2a9dab9fde78a49d3ce33b5c6a9f45e1283

commit_message:
Set physical_network on baremetal nodes

Set the physical_network property of barematal
ports to 'ctlplane' by default.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment
Change-Id: I726c72e26ae3707d4f8fa7396bfac1840c134a27

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-06 21:32:54.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] convert per-service logging configuration to service_config_settings

The initial fluentd client implementation predates the introduction of
service_config_settings, and necessitated some invasive changes to
what is now common/serivces.yaml. This commit begins the process of
modifying services to use the service_config_settings based
configuration mechanism supported by more recent versions of the
fluentd support in puppet-tripleo.

commit_message:
logging: use service_config_settings for fluentd

The initial fluentd client implementation predates the introduction of
service_config_settings, and necessitated some invasive changes to
what is now common/serivces.yaml. This commit modifies existing
services to use the service_config_settings based configuration
mechanism supported by more recent versions of the fluentd support in
puppet-tripleo.

Partial-bug: #1715187
Depends-On: I3149902401d68d6fd236073a73a20f982d4b952a
Depends-On: I2b057190ec0e4e75ee4ee47ebe0164c2644e5ab7
Depends-On: Ie7df4b8b94cb0ae38096ab95800f211ef1cd8455
Change-Id: I28028ffa00df2da8e0478a551d3de89c3ee46e1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 00:07:32.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor GUI logging to use message claims

We were incorrectly retrieving messages from the logging Zaqar queue.
Each time we ran the workflow, only ten messages were retrieved.

Running the workflow a second time would produce the same logging file
because contrary to what I had thought before, the `queue_messages`
action doesn't "pop" the messages from the queue.

The proper way of using Zaqar is by claiming messages.  Each consumer
claims some messages.  We ask Zaqar for messages, and it gives them to
us.  Those messages are now ours and we can process them.  No other
consumer can touch them.  Once we're done processing them, we have to
manually delete those messages using the previously acquired IDs.
Again, there is no way to request a large number of messages from the
queue so we have to resort to calling our sub-workflow recursively until
we run out of messages.

Change-Id: Ie8d1762b3c61ff96ef8b4d32e15e758ef2f618d3
Closes-Bug: 1733633
'}, {'created': '2018-02-07 18:43:45.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor GUI logging to use message claims

We were incorrectly retrieving messages from the logging Zaqar queue.
Each time we ran the workflow, only ten messages were retrieved.

Running the workflow a second time would produce the same logging file
because contrary to what I had thought before, the `queue_messages`
action doesn't "pop" the messages from the queue.

The proper way of using Zaqar is by claiming messages.  Each consumer
claims some messages.  We ask Zaqar for messages, and it gives them to
us.  Those messages are now ours and we can process them.  No other
consumer can touch them.  Once we're done processing them, we have to
manually delete those messages using the previously acquired IDs.
Again, there is no way to request a large number of messages from the
queue so we have to resort to calling `get_messages` recursively until
we run out of messages.

Change-Id: Ie8d1762b3c61ff96ef8b4d32e15e758ef2f618d3
Closes-Bug: 1733633
'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 13:46:59.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor GUI logging to use message claims

We were incorrectly retrieving messages from the logging Zaqar queue.
Each time we ran the workflow, only ten messages were retrieved.

Running the workflow a second time would produce the same logging file
because contrary to what I had thought before, the `queue_messages`
action doesn't "pop" the messages from the queue.

The proper way of using Zaqar is by claiming messages.  Each consumer
claims some messages.  We ask Zaqar for messages, and it gives them to
us.  Those messages are now ours and we can process them.  No other
consumer can touch them.  Once we're done processing them, we have to
manually delete those messages using the previously acquired IDs.
Again, there is no way to request a large number of messages from the
queue so we have to resort to calling `get_messages` recursively until
we run out of messages.

Change-Id: Ie8d1762b3c61ff96ef8b4d32e15e758ef2f618d3
Closes-Bug: 1733633
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor GUI logging to use message claims

We were incorrectly retrieving messages from the logging Zaqar queue.
Each time we ran the workflow, only ten messages were retrieved.

Running the workflow a second time would produce the same logging file
because contrary to what I had thought before, the `queue_messages`
action doesn't "pop" the messages from the queue.

The proper way of using Zaqar is by claiming messages.  Each consumer
claims some messages.  We ask Zaqar for messages, and it gives them to
us.  Those messages are now ours and we can process them.  No other
consumer can touch them.  Once we're done processing them, we have to
manually delete those messages using the previously acquired IDs.
Again, there is no way to request a large number of messages from the
queue so we have to resort to calling `get_messages` recursively until
we run out of messages.

Change-Id: Ie8d1762b3c61ff96ef8b4d32e15e758ef2f618d3
Closes-Bug: 1733633

commit_message:
Use an epoch as default, not a datetime

The `epoch_to_formatted_date` function expects an epoch, not a datetime.

commit_message:
Fix EnabledServices output so it can capture the pacemaker check

Currently the output of stack output show overcloud EnabledServices
doesn't contain any '"pacemaker"' string but only 'pacemaker'. This
change makes it use the correct string so the command check works
properly.

Change-Id: Ic296d55120e107e5a0ac9d3166525a8a4edcd1c1

commit_message:
Remove container prepare steps from FFU tasks

This change removes the container images local registry upload and
environment file preparation from the FFU tasks. These steps should
be run outside tripleo-upgrade and the location of the environment
file containing the images details can be set via the parameter
container_registry_file.

Change-Id: Ib481867186e32b7f232434fa287b73b49a61c6b8

commit_message:
Ignore same file errors for templates processor

When copying templates or files with the
process-templates.py's shutil, ignore cases when
the source and the destination are same files.

This allows the following scenario:
  - Symlink t-h-t from the installed package to a work dir
  - Process j2 templates with overwrite in the work dir

Required-by: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542875

Change-Id: I9a9c32f05fde325709998f4fe8bc7fef6c25b5c5
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Prevent apache from listening on default ports

This fixes an issue where the containers used for TLS proxy would
listen on the same port and thus fail to start with:

(98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to
address [::]:80
(98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to
address 0.0.0.0:80

This change applies the same logic that Kolla does for containers
images with apache in it:

https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/31259fa595392c25a5e21d03c13e8896648a7695/docker/heat/heat-base/Dockerfile.j2#L20-L21
https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/31259fa595392c25a5e21d03c13e8896648a7695/docker/heat/heat-base/extend_start.sh#L10-L21

Change-Id: Ic2fd3f65b06755ae0869af7b39bcdbcb8ec03774
Closes-Bug: #1734879
(cherry picked from commit ed2ea0680fc5f34f2835fe44d58a4aef2ced5f15)
Conflicts:
      container-images/tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2

[{'created': '2017-11-30 09:20:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix healthchecks permissions

Set the permissions on the files rather than recursively on the
directory otherwise symlinks are ignored.

According to the chmod man page:

"For each symbolic link listed on the command line, chmod changes the
permissions of the pointed-to  file.  In contrast, chmod ignores
symbolic links encountered during recursive directory traversals."

'}]
commit_message:
Fix healthchecks permissions

Set the permissions on the files rather than recursively on the
directory otherwise symlinks are ignored.

According to the chmod man page:

"For each symbolic link listed on the command line, chmod changes the
permissions of the pointed-to  file.  In contrast, chmod ignores
symbolic links encountered during recursive directory traversals."

Closes-Bug: #1718895
Change-Id: I3c6545e0be2f70a0f7e90fbf9fda2646c36217dd
(cherry picked from commit 0460c8088d892913559a657168d8026b9f942db9)
Conflicts:
      container-images/tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2

commit_message:
Allow running mistral-api service via wsgi in container

A review to add the necessary packages to run mistral-api via wsgi was
proposed to kolla in I07ffd0b398e20065fff27c30d0842b94090ca0ad but this
is unlikely we'll be able to backport to stable/pike due to the nature
of the change.

So make the necessary change in our override file so we have more
freedom to backport.

Change-Id: Id2bfb6ba761821616301f996dd68fea8f07ae5f3
Related-Bug: #1724607
(cherry picked from commit 1a4da389bb2e3d7bf703ebc0dd10fc46a99bd554)

commit_message:
Use relative path for ansible role install

This fixes permissions issues when trying to run:

'python setup.py install' in a venv (non-root)

Change-Id: I10c350052097b466d9ce860cefb551e404efbdcd
Closes-bug: #1744381

'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 19:50:10.000000000', 'message': 'Update FS027 to use latest bits for containerized undercloud

- Deploy python-tripleoclient and python-tripleoclient-heat-installer
  for now. In Rocky, we'll only deploy python-tripleoclient.
- Deploy the undercloud with "--use-heat" argument.
- Add networking parameters to have a working containerized undercloud.
  These bits will probably move later but for now we need them.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud

commit_message:
Update FS027 to use latest bits for containerized undercloud

- Deploy the undercloud with "--use-heat" argument.
- Add networking parameters to have a working containerized undercloud:
  these bits will probably move later but for now we need them.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud

Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin Andr√© <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>

Depends-On: I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8
Change-Id: I815c4f2bf458032f318ef198edcbdffdd80d084b

commit_message:
Use extra_vars to pass ireallymeanit

The ireallymeanit parameter does not work when passed using
vars in the ansible inventory. This change passes the option
using extra_vars.

Change-Id: Iabf9e20e65f7def1bbbc48995cbc956937a69e15
Related-Bug: #1745494
(cherry picked from commit 6f189058e514292cb4c86f5bea5791d6794117e0)

[{'created': '2018-02-05 22:11:10.000000000', 'message': "Add CephClient and CephExternal to the Telemetry role

Previously the deployment of the Telemetry role with Ceph would
fail as the Ceph clients didn't get configured on the Telemetry
nodes.

Closes-Bug: 1746525
Change-Id: I0644d028c269afce4c561bbf5b8ca1f2c4addda2
(cherry picked from commit e99296b3f42e28cfc9928cd1e5f0c6016ef4f691)

commit_message:
Add CephClient and CephExternal to the Telemetry role

Previously the deployment of the Telemetry role with Ceph would
fail as the Ceph clients didn't get configured on the Telemetry
nodes.

Closes-Bug: 1746525
Change-Id: I0644d028c269afce4c561bbf5b8ca1f2c4addda2

commit_message:
ffu: tripleo-packages repo management

This change introduces some basic repo management for fast-forward
upgrades using the tripleo-repos tool as the default implementation.

The following parameters have been added to the template to allow for
additional implementations to be added.

FastForwardRepoType - Currently defaults to tripleo-repos
FastForwardRepoArgs - Currently defaults to tripleo-repos args for O and P

bp fast-forward-upgrades
Change-Id: I92f6f5015f34e6c5e8ef131f303d9c8144d1c83e

commit_message:
Always evaluate step first in conditional

If we use variables defined in later step in conditional before
checking which step are we on we will fail.

Resolves: rhbz#1535457
Closes-Bug: #1743764
Change-Id: Ic21f6eb5c4101f230fa894cd0829a11e2f0ef39b

commit_message:
partitioner: do not use hash() to determine object identity

The `hash` method is random on Python¬†3, so it's not consistent between. Just
use the string representation of the object as a default.

Change-Id: I84e2b19b64dc1641f9758429248dc6b928122b18
Closes-Bug: #1743243

commit_message:
[cfg] Introduce rally.common.cfg

As for config options we are using oslo_config library.
It limits us to override config options based on used deployment/env.

To get control of all options and how they are obtained, let's restrict
usage of oslo_config directly and force everyone to use rally.common.cfg
which has the same interface.

Change-Id: Ia845958b50b62d971f1343c03da2552049aa4363

[{'created': '2018-02-12 16:35:11.000000000', 'message': "Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I71e15a31cd541ea9ba53f6cd74f035a0768d1d07
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-12 10:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 10:16:53.000000000', 'message': "bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043 and
implements a more targeted solution.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
the task to enable swap is now fully idempotent too, so the reason
for the initial implementation is also solved.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
(cherry picked from commit aad094549ecacd1c1f9217e6bfa4286213b4b36e)
"}]
commit_message:
bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043 and
implements a more targeted solution.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
the task to enable swap is now fully idempotent too, so the reason
for the initial implementation is also solved.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
(cherry picked from commit aad094549ecacd1c1f9217e6bfa4286213b4b36e)

commit_message:
doc: mention that --on-shared-storage is not needed with nova evacuate

The 2.14 microversion makes the --on-shared-storage calculation
happen automatically in the compute service, so we should make a note
of that in the evacuate CLI docs.

Change-Id: I88806897a2412971b3c7488155f17156ae1c7bf9

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia5f219328c804fba276b9d122af3237c5ed290fc

So, it seems the actual culprit is this line
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/ironic-inspector/tree/ironic_inspector/common/keystone.py#n28
where we set the default for auth_type to password. Thus in the old way of setting config (with auth_strategy) we are loading the session while not having overriden the auth_type to 'none' yet - and it tries to load the password plugin that requires auth_url.

That means to support the backward compat with 'auth_strategy' we just need to move the auth_type override at the top of this method.

Also, by not loading the session from config you are loosing all the session-related options defined in it - like SSL ones, that might be really needed even when not using keystone auth."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-02-09 06:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-02-09 07:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-02-09 07:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:12:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
ironic_inspector: ironic: Fix 'auth_type' when 'auth_strategy' is used

We should override the 'auth_type' to 'none' when using the old way of
setting up authentication with 'auth_strategy' so we can override the
default 'auth_type' value before getting the session information.
This fixes the following issue

Unhandled error: MissingRequiredOptions: Auth plugin requires parameters which were not given: auth_url

This also adds a new testcase to test the strategy='noauth' scenario.

Closes-Bug: #1748263
Change-Id: I875e2b17f5c6829ad81f86c32959cb106bf57e53

commit_message:
Move setup-utility before other plays

If we setup the utility containers before previous plays, we can
have a container that's ready for use in all contextes, because
it would contain all the necessary clients.

Change-Id: Iff34a005ca3d5a6dfcd7ff8d9d5bcc6d51441789

[{'created': '2018-02-12 08:56:47.000000000', 'message': "Remove impossible tests

We haven't managed to pass functional tests for CentOS this cycle,
it seems overly ambitious to think the upgrade tests would pass.

We also removed the periodics from centos/suse, because they are
all timing out, and therefore are using resources for nothing.
We keep the check jobs to be aware of timings.

Change-Id: I4900cbc22da83582ddd48af7df99d66de1a129f9
(cherry picked from commit 0aeab78147ae9b42661dd2ed5d762d9cbca4f2c2)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove impossible tests

We haven't managed to pass functional tests for CentOS this cycle,
it seems overly ambitious to think the upgrade tests would pass.

We also removed the periodics from centos/suse, because they are
all timing out, and therefore are using resources for nothing.
We keep the check jobs to be aware of timings.

Change-Id: I4900cbc22da83582ddd48af7df99d66de1a129f9

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I7f06c0be47f57a9c1ee3cadc7328b1b1b138b3cd
(cherry picked from commit aede01a0a8d21d49fc4a811650b5ae5bdcb17adc)

commit_message:
KubeADM: Label namespaces

This PS removes the duplicate labeling of K8s namespaces everytime
the kubeadm image is run - as this action is performed by the
container itself while deploying k8s. It also updates the playbook
to label the kube-public ns.

Change-Id: Icfaabe54d263e0bbc52f2ac11835cb5d92ad32a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-11 22:16:45.000000000', 'message': "Handle volume-backed instances in IsolatedHostsFilter

The RequestSpec.image object for a volume-backed instance will
not have the 'id' attribute set because the
nova.utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume() method doesn't convert
the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id
field. It is unclear if there are intentional reasons for omitting
this information, but the IsolatedHostsFilter has just never supported
filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

The logic within the filter depends on the
restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images config option, which
defaults to True. When True, a volume-backed instance will not be
put on an isolated host. When False, a volume-backed instance can
go on any host, isolated or not.

Again, it's unclear if we should actually be filtering volume-backed
servers using the image_id from the volume_image_metadata or not,
but it's not what we've historically done so this change simply
fixes the regression bug.

commit_message:
Handle volume-backed instances in IsolatedHostsFilter

The RequestSpec.image object for a volume-backed instance will
not have the 'id' attribute set because the
nova.utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume() method doesn't convert
the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id
field. It is unclear if there are intentional reasons for omitting
this information, but the IsolatedHostsFilter has just never supported
filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

The logic within the filter depends on the
restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images config option, which
defaults to True. When True, a volume-backed instance will not be
put on an isolated host. When False, a volume-backed instance can
go on any host, isolated or not.

Again, it's unclear if we should actually be filtering volume-backed
servers using the image_id from the volume_image_metadata or not,
but it's not what we've historically done so this change simply
fixes the regression bug.

Change-Id: Ieb8abb1a3f04ce008f9617e051e4d720dbe6917a
Closes-Bug: #1746483

commit_message:
Add regression test for BFV+IsolatedHostsFilter failure

Creating a volume-backed server while using the IsolatedHostsFilter
results in a NoValidHost failure because the filter tries to load
the RequestSpec.image.id but when you create a server from a volume,
an image is not required directly in the server create request.

Change-Id: Id21e0afa5cec401555bee679193c256e55be863b
Related-Bug: #1746483

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 23:22:39.000000000', 'message': 'Granular Resource Request Syntax (Rocky)

As generic and nested resource providers begin to crystallize and be
exercised, it becomes necessary to be able to express:

- Requesting an allocation of a particular resource class with a
  particular set of traits, and requesting a *different* allocation of
  the *same* resource class with a *different* set of traits.

- Ensuring that requests of certain resources are allocated from the
  same resource provider.

- The ability to spread allocations of effectively-identical resources
  across multiple resource providers in situations of high saturation.

This specification attempts to address these requirements by way of a
numbered syntax on resource and trait keys in flavor extra_specs and the
GET /allocation_candidates Placement API.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I01aeb90515c8f4a1f0e47db135f40969ad679127
blueprint: granular-resource-requests
Previously-Approved: Queens

commit_message:
Granular Resource Request Syntax (Rocky)

As generic and nested resource providers begin to crystallize and be
exercised, it becomes necessary to be able to express:

- Requesting an allocation of a particular resource class with a
  particular set of traits, and requesting a *different* allocation of
  the *same* resource class with a *different* set of traits.

- Ensuring that requests of certain resources are allocated from the
  same resource provider.

- The ability to spread allocations of effectively-identical resources
  across multiple resource providers in situations of high saturation.

This specification attempts to address these requirements by way of a
numbered syntax on resource and trait keys in flavor extra_specs and the
GET /allocation_candidates Placement API.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I01aeb90515c8f4a1f0e47db135f40969ad679127
blueprint: granular-resource-requests
Previously-Approved: Queens

commit_message:
Remove redundant action key on NetworkDeployment

action was specified twice on NetworkDeployment. The first occurrence is
just ignored by Heat, so remove it for clarity.

Change-Id: Iff24a65c09f37f2777787e7436f7902f5e6a122f
Closes-Bug: #1747072

commit_message:
tests: test-keystone-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: Iaf00987dab9cdd108df6095e76321126f45a47b6
(cherry picked from commit a48a73089286a370312a35fc7df54a6a3a513fa2)

messages: [{'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11561, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 03:15:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update virtual_environment for genconfig and genpolicy

It is not necessary to create two new virtual environments
when run tox with genconfig and genpolicy. We can use pep8
virtual_environment for those tox., it will reduce time to
run tox.

Change-Id: Ia07d325ed9550c8a201039754d96341f051c63f0
'}]
commit_message:
Update virtual_environment for genconfig and genpolicy

It is not necessary to create two new virtual environments
when run tox with genconfig and genpolicy. We can use pep8
virtual_environment for those tox., it will reduce time to
run tox.

Change-Id: Ia07d325ed9550c8a201039754d96341f051c63f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 11:31:40.000000000', 'message': "Pick up general URI when constructing barbican endpoint

Seems like keystone will ask barbican for its infomation
including endpoint. So barbican should handle general endpoint
e.g., 'http://localhost:9311' or 'http://localhost/key-manager'

Change-Id: Id7230198583355a83b1ee4acef3da7cde7118794
(cherry picked from commit a84670b8c59a4cf1834cf43b68a7c22ac963bfdf)
"}]
commit_message:
Pick up general URI when constructing barbican endpoint

Seems like keystone will ask barbican for its infomation
including endpoint. So barbican should handle general endpoint
e.g., 'http://localhost:9311' or 'http://localhost/key-manager'

Change-Id: Id7230198583355a83b1ee4acef3da7cde7118794
(cherry picked from commit a84670b8c59a4cf1834cf43b68a7c22ac963bfdf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-04 16:00:29.000000000', 'message': 'Adding #nosec for pycrypto use

As the pycrypto library is being replaced by the cryptography module,
the bandit library would like to warn the use of pycrypto in [0]. Currently,
barbican still use pycrypto and work is being done to update that in [1],
this patch set proposes to #nosec the outstanding pycrypto use for the
bandit patch to pass - the #nosec should be consequently removed in [1].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530287/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/458196/

Change-Id: I0b1a90c3a47ad6d3b18597e5315e9f017854a146
'}]
commit_message:
Adding #nosec for pycrypto use

As the pycrypto library is being replaced by the cryptography module,
the bandit library would like to warn the use of pycrypto in [0]. Currently,
barbican still use pycrypto and work is being done to update that in [1],
this patch set proposes to #nosec the outstanding pycrypto use for the
bandit patch to pass - the #nosec should be consequently removed in [1].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530287/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/458196/

Change-Id: I0b1a90c3a47ad6d3b18597e5315e9f017854a146

"}, {'created': '2018-01-24 23:39:53.000000000', 'message': "Validate instances are accessible before messing with their disks

This should help to isolate failures that are generic from specific test
failures related to barbican. If a test can't pass simple connectivity
check, it's probably broken, and there is no point to attach disks,

commit_message:
Validate instances are accessible before messing with their disks

This should help to isolate failures that are generic from specific test
failures related to barbican. If a test can't pass simple connectivity
check, it's probably broken, and there is no point to attach disks,
because it won't work.

Related-Bug: #1742936
Change-Id: I96cd35392f638c0e5b668f4f3b15cf4cd6114b71

commit_message:
libvirt: Collocate encryptor and volume driver calls

This change introduces new utility methods for attaching and detaching
frontend volume encryptors. These methods centralise the optional
fetching of encryption metadata associated with a volume, fetching of the
required encryptor and calls to detach or attach the encryptor.

These new utility methods are called either after initially connecting
to or before disconnecting from a volume. This ensures encryptors are
correctly connected when swapping volumes for example, where previously
no attempt was made to attach an encryptor to the target volume.

The request context is provided to swap_volume and various other config
generation related methods to allow for the lookup of the relevant
encryption metadata if it is not provided.

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to Ifc01dbf98545104c998ab96f65ff8623a6db0f28 &
I0bfb11296430dfffe9b091ae7c3a793617bd9d0d introducing cinderv3 attach
and live migration support during Queens.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022
(cherry picked from commit cd3eb60c2c00bcccfa9ccd4bf9d1a96ae7a5cd88)

commit_message:
Remove unused argument from LibvirtDriver._disconnect_volume

_disconnect_volume was being passed disk_dev, which was is name of the
disk as presented to the gust. However, _disconnect_volume is only
concerned with unmounting the volume from the host, so this isn't
relevant.

A couple of volume drivers were using it for logging. We remove these
because it wasn't done consistently, is better done by the caller, and
isn't required as the information is available from other log
messages.

In the very minor associated debug log cleanup we also remove logging
of connection_info from one volume driver, which is potential security
bug.

We also do some associated cleanup in a few volume driver tests which
were assuming that disconnect_volume was being passed disk_info rather
than disk_dev, and that connection_info['data'] is related to
disk_info, which it isn't.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): The above conflict is due to
99c8168b93037cec710690d3b95348d835ead8f7 not being present on
stable/pike, introducing cinderv3 use to the live migration flows.

Change-Id: I61a0bee9e71e9a67f6a7c04a7bfd6e77fe818a77
(cherry picked from commit b912556ae01a4925aabc2610756a7564e32df637)

commit_message:
Removed unused argument from LibvirtDriver._connect_volume

_connect_volume was being passed disk_info as an argument. However,
the purpose of _connect_volume is to mount a volume on the compute
host, and disk_info only contains metadata about how the disk will be
presented to a guest. It's therefore not relevant, so it's not
surprising that no drivers are using it.

Change-Id: I843b5c46f9f93a30e7121259feff17a8170a2e48
(cherry picked from commit cfa6d3ae30282991f66606af1e06613698b0efb3)

commit_message:
Delete tokens from DB is not required in case of Fernet.  

Fernet is a non-persistent token which is not stored in any DB.
When a user tries to change the password, keystone deletes and 
revokes all the tokens specific to that user.
In case of Fernet it should not look for any persistent DB.

Partial-Bug: #1714937

Change-Id: I821782be7bd02e526eaf6288c825b954c6b8df6e

This commit disables the config generator for the Keystone
package. The test will only work in a tox generated venv but
fail when tests are run by ostestr: It runs oslo-config-generator
in a shell. This in turn requires python-keystone be available
for oslo-config-generator to use at a time when we haven't
even built, let alone installed, a python-keystone package
yet.

commit_message:
keystone: disable config generator test

This commit disables the config generator test for the Keystone
package. The test will only work in a tox generated venv but
fail when tests are run by ostestr: It runs oslo-config-generator
in a shell. This in turn requires python-keystone be available
for oslo-config-generator to use at a time when we haven't
even built, let alone installed, a python-keystone package
yet.

Change-Id: I8de2150cd527491db100703dac165ce950f205bf

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I0d50b3898552ff7edddc0f74dbedce9e4a316c5d

commit_message:
Use config-download-environment.yaml during FFU

This change uses the config download environment file instead of
noop-deploy-steps.yaml. This step is used for updating the stack
outputs, used by the overcloud config download command that
generates the ansible playbooks run during FFU.

Change-Id: I1168bbefc45d686ec7d05abaaa2fe2b5e1cf840a

commit_message:
Move queens implemented specs

This moves the completed queens specs to the implemented
directory, adds the redirects and also removes the queens-template
symlink from the approved directory and docs.

This was done using:

  $ tox -e move-implemented-specs -- queens

Change-Id: I9e4d9aec4a1ced181ef7850627b9c67de376beae

[{'created': '2017-12-13 11:37:06.000000000', 'message': "Improve debugging possibilities for docker-puppet.py time handling

We faced strange issue where on some environments docker-puppet.py
picks up /etc/hosts as modified, even though that shouldn't be the
case (LP bug 1709689). Printing the timestamp of the_origin_of_time,
saving it to a persistent directory and making sure /etc/localtime is
mounted into docker-puppet containers should make finding the root
cause easier.

Change-Id: I2ea197673b470379ead295058b6952cce3a69606
Closes-Bug: #1737954
"}, {'created': '2017-12-13 14:16:25.000000000', 'message': "Improve debugging possibilities for docker-puppet.py time handling

We faced issue where on some environments docker-puppet.py picks up
/etc/hosts as modified, even though that shouldn't be the case (LP bug
1709689). On the last occasion we found the cause to be desynced time
on the host machine of a virtual setup, and subsequent NTP sync of
overcloud nodes (causing a 5 hour skip back in time) racing with
docker-puppet.py.

Still, more info to debug these kinds of issues would be nice to
have. Printing the timestamp of origin_of_time, saving it to a
persistent directory and making sure /etc/localtime is mounted into
docker-puppet containers should make finding the root cause on such
occasions easier.

Change-Id: I2ea197673b470379ead295058b6952cce3a69606
Closes-Bug: #1737954
"}]
commit_message:
Improve debugging possibilities for docker-puppet.py time handling

We faced issue where on some environments docker-puppet.py picks up
/etc/hosts as modified, even though that shouldn't be the case (LP bug
1709689). On the last occasion we found the cause to be desynced time
on the host machine of a virtual setup, and subsequent NTP sync of
overcloud nodes (causing a 5 hour skip back in time) racing with
docker-puppet.py.

Still, more info to debug these kinds of issues would be nice to
have. Printing the timestamp of origin_of_time, saving it to a
persistent directory and making sure /etc/localtime is mounted into
docker-puppet containers should make finding the root cause on such
occasions easier.

Change-Id: I2ea197673b470379ead295058b6952cce3a69606
Closes-Bug: #1737954

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 06:09:09.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce no-quorum-policy=stop for all cluster sizes

Previously quorum was only enforced on clusters with 3 or more nodes
under the mistaken assumption that it is not possible to have quorum
with only 2 nodes. The corosync votequorum agent which is configured
allows for quorum in 2-node scenarios using the "two_node" option which
is already configured by the charm.

In this new scenario, corosync requires that both nodes are present in
order to initially form cluster quorum, but also allows a single
surviving node to keep quorum or take-over once it was already started
while in contact with the other node.

The net effect of this change is that nodes are unable to startup
independently (which is when split brain situations are frequently seen
due to network startup delays, etc). There is no change to the runtime
behavior (there is still a risk that both nodes can go active if the
network connection between them is interrupted, this is an inherrent
risk of two-node clusters and requires a 3-node cluster to fix).

Thus we update the CRM configuration to always set no-quorum-policy=stop
regardless of whether the cluster has 2 or 3+ nodes.

In the event that you need to startup a cluster manually with only 1
node, first verify that the second node is definitely either powered off
or that corosync/pacemaker and all managed resources are stopped (thus
we can be sure it won't go split brain, because it cannot startup again
until it is in contact with the other node). Then you can override
cluster startup using this command to temporarily set the expected votes
to 1 instead of 2:
$ corosync-quorumtool -e1

Once the second node comes back up and corosync reconnects, the expected
vote count will automatically be reset to the configured value (or if
corosync is restarted).

Change-Id: Ica6a3ba387a4ab362400a25ff2ba0145e0218e1f
'}, {'created': '2018-02-09 06:11:15.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce no-quorum-policy=stop for all cluster sizes

Thus we update the CRM configuration to always set no-quorum-policy=stop
regardless of whether the cluster has 2 or 3+ nodes.

to 1 instead of 2:
$ corosync-quorumtool -e1

Once the second node comes back up and corosync reconnects, the expected

Change-Id: Ica6a3ba387a4ab362400a25ff2ba0145e0218e1f

commit_message:
Enforce no-quorum-policy=stop for all cluster sizes

Previously quorum was only enforced on clusters with 3 or more nodes
under the mistaken assumption that it is not possible to have quorum
with only 2 nodes. The corosync votequorum agent which is configured
allows for quorum in 2-node scenarios using the "two_node" option which
is already configured by the charm.

In this new scenario, corosync requires that both nodes are present in
order to initially form cluster quorum, but also allows a single
surviving node to keep quorum or take-over once it was already started
while in contact with the other node.

The net effect of this change is that nodes are unable to startup
independently (which is when split brain situations are frequently seen
due to network startup delays, etc). There is no change to the runtime
behavior (there is still a risk that both nodes can go active if the
network connection between them is interrupted, this is an inherrent
risk of two-node clusters and requires a 3-node cluster to fix).

Thus we update the CRM configuration to always set no-quorum-policy=stop
regardless of whether the cluster has 2 or 3+ nodes.

In the event that you need to startup a cluster manually with only 1
node, first verify that the second node is definitely either powered off
or that corosync/pacemaker and all managed resources are stopped (thus
we can be sure it won't go split brain, because it cannot startup again
until it is in contact with the other node). Then you can override
cluster startup using this command to temporarily set the expected votes
to 1 instead of 2:
$ corosync-quorumtool -e1

Once the second node comes back up and corosync reconnects, the expected
vote count will automatically be reset to the configured value (or if
corosync is restarted).

Change-Id: Ica6a3ba387a4ab362400a25ff2ba0145e0218e1f

commit_message:
Revert "Don't run deployed-server_prepare.sh with config-download"

This reverts commit 9a163ca1e37f309210868921ff202ff93d2bb124.

This appears to have broken the containers and 3node job on
stable/pike which does not have config-download.

Change-Id: I339e9b46528b16e4131b275849d544f95ae68cdb
Closes-Bug: #1748315

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-11 17:58:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update rabbitmq install for cluster and upgrade tests

The current rabbitmq installation playbook assumes that there is
only a single rabbitmq container. While this works for most roles,
when more than one is desired in a test it requires a duplicated
playbook in the role which behaves differently.

This patch updates the playbook to make it more universal.

Change-Id: I372e0db39989ef412ab4301fcd5493efb48bdbe9
'}]
commit_message:
Update rabbitmq install for cluster and upgrade tests

The current rabbitmq installation playbook assumes that there is
only a single rabbitmq container. While this works for most roles,
when more than one is desired in a test it requires a duplicated
playbook in the role which behaves differently.

This patch updates the playbook to make it more universal.

Change-Id: I372e0db39989ef412ab4301fcd5493efb48bdbe9

Neither this patch nor the bug make the case that this is the right thing to do.

If metadata is for user tagging of volumes, and a user creates a volume with a particular tag (metadata), why would we wipe it unnecessarily when restoring a backup that has no conflicting metadata?

I think this needs more design thought before assuming the current behavior is wrong.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:42:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Clear metadata when restoring backup with no metadata

Also renamed variable to not hide reserved word.

a series upgrade, not just a rabbitmq upgrade.

default test just be a deployment. This allows us to
more clearly see where something breaks.

commit_message:
Implement separate deploy and upgrade tests

The current functional test does a full upgrade process,
but uses the same current role for both the previous
version and the new version.

Ideally we want to test the initial deploy using the
previous series' role, so that we're actually testing
a series upgrade, not just a rabbitmq upgrade.

This patch separates the upgrade test out and makes the
default test just be a deployment. This allows us to
more clearly see where something breaks.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543245
Change-Id: I43e1e224cd4237ac37b40fde5ce7c279331a012d

subject: Join cluster without using a failed task
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-12 10:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nSeems ok for backport, due to the fact many ppl are thinking this is a failure.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 10:17:40.000000000', 'message': "Join cluster without using a failed task

Currently a new node joining the cluster is done by using
a try/rescue operation which always fails for a new node,
causing a lot of confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch ensures that the implementation no longer does
that.

In order to prevent lint check failures, each join task
has a 'changed_when: true' added.

Change-Id: Ic1da9f3ad1016831fe37643165880e7ff98ca923
(cherry picked from commit 83b398e18bf7eb5966e52e9f731eb2b5643f412a)
"}]
commit_message:
Join cluster without using a failed task

Currently a new node joining the cluster is done by using
a try/rescue operation which always fails for a new node,
causing a lot of confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch ensures that the implementation no longer does
that.

In order to prevent lint check failures, each join task
has a 'changed_when: true' added.

Change-Id: Ic1da9f3ad1016831fe37643165880e7ff98ca923
(cherry picked from commit 83b398e18bf7eb5966e52e9f731eb2b5643f412a)

commit_message:
Ensure the JSON-Schema covers the legacy v2 API

Similar to change Ie165b2a79efd56a299d2d4ebe40a6904a340414f,
these were some other APIs missing 2.0 for the query schema
lower-bound which means v2.0 requests weren't getting validated
by the schema.

Change-Id: I1b0fc5dfd424b42e381e5c3b703cf7473b9fcbcb
Related-Bug: #1701451

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 11:43:24.000000000', 'message': 'Make bdms querying in multiple cells use scatter-gather

This patch makes the querying of bdms from multiple cells in the
get_minimum_version_all_cells function of extended_volumes use
scatter_gather_cells thus making the process, parallel. It also adds
warnings in case a cell is not available (which the operator can later
tweak if an exception needs to be raised).

Change-Id: I0e05eb1e2ad37962968b79100bf4a96c7d6ddd8f
Closes-Bug: #1747650
'}, {'created': '2018-02-07 10:52:00.000000000', 'message': 'Make bdms querying in multi-cell use scatter-gather and ignore down cell

This patch makes the querying of bdms from multiple cells in the
_get_instance_bdms_in_multiple_cells function of extended_volumes use
scatter_gather_cells thus making the process, parallel. It also adds
warnings in case a cell is not available; which the operator can later
tweak, if an exception needs to be raised. So for now, cells that are
not reachable are ignored and it proceeds to the next cell.

Change-Id: I0e05eb1e2ad37962968b79100bf4a96c7d6ddd8f
Closes-Bug: #1747650
'}]
commit_message:
Make bdms querying in multi-cell use scatter-gather and ignore down cell

This patch makes the querying of bdms from multiple cells in the
_get_instance_bdms_in_multiple_cells function of extended_volumes use
scatter_gather_cells thus making the process, parallel. It also adds
warnings in case a cell is not available; which the operator can later
tweak, if an exception needs to be raised. So for now, cells that are
not reachable are ignored and it proceeds to the next cell.

Change-Id: I0e05eb1e2ad37962968b79100bf4a96c7d6ddd8f
Closes-Bug: #1747650

subject: Remove OpenStack/Ceph/Virt repo from CentOS
messages:
[{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-11 13:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-08-11 13:21:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

-1 In favor of this, but we need to hold off until Queens. Don't think we should be pushing this so late in release cycle.

Also, system-config install_puppet.sh also installs RDO, that needs to be removed.

devstack-gate installs openvswitch, until we migrate from it, or have devstack-gate enable this logic (like we did for EPEL), things are going to break."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-11 13:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/03/493003/1/check/gate-project-config-layout/8ab62e2/ : SUCCESS in 9m 17s
- gate-project-config-dib http://logs.openstack.org/03/493003/1/check/gate-project-config-dib/50d101b/ : FAILURE in 2m 25s'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-11 15:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Paul -- it looks like it may be getting removed there, too:

  http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml#n523

Also, the install_puppet.sh appears to be commented out.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-11 18:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-11 18:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fixed an errant comma in the JSON.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-11 19:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/03/493003/2/check/gate-project-config-layout/fe400e3/ : SUCCESS in 10m 43s
- gate-project-config-dib http://logs.openstack.org/03/493003/2/check/gate-project-config-dib/56c1acd/ : SUCCESS in 2m 13s'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-08-11 20:07:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Actually, you are right. We don't use install_puppet.sh any more."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-08-14 07:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I feel like this is right for the generic case.  If we can purge it all from devstack is another question'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-08-14 17:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

devstack-gate will need to be first updated before we land this.  If somebody wanted to work on that today.  Basically, d-g needs to now install / configure this repo (using properly infra mirrors), disable the repo, then yum install openvswitch --enable-repo=centos-opentack-ocata for just that package.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-15 03:48:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I can take a crack at that, Paul. I'll tinker around in project-config to see if I can find what needs to be changed. If you can point me in the right direction, that would help too. ;)"}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-15 03:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-15 12:29:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Workflow

Paul -- I dug into devstack and found this: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/stack.sh#L330-L331

It looks like the devstack gate is already installing the RDO package if it isn't there already."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-08-15 19:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> It looks like the devstack gate is already installing the RDO package if it isn't there already.

It's not so much devstack but devstack-gate (although that path you mentioned is probably untested, but that's another issue)

the problem is more the use of ovs to setup bridges between nodes in [1].  clarkb has I1854244eee857141b2aaf280cf3f4e33e687f421 in testing to use vxlan instead, but that's a somewhat larger change than we're comfortable with at this point in the release cycle

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/devstack-vm-gate.sh"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-08-15 19:26:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

during the build, only two packages are pulled from these repos

 2017-08-15 00:34:45,290 INFO nodepool.image.build.centos-7: python-pip           noarch   8.1.2-1.el7       centos-openstack-ocata   1.7 M
 2017-08-15 00:34:45,290 INFO nodepool.image.build.centos-7: python2-setuptools   noarch   22.0.5-1.el7      centos-openstack-ocata   485 k

this is by pip-and-virtualenv.  i don't think this will cause problems, because we put those packages into the ignore list after installing them, then overwrite things with upstream versions anyway.

the dependencies are installed via devstack [1].  that has no concept of enabling a repo.  Will think on this a bit...

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/functions.sh#n1052"}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-08-24 13:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-24 13:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/03/493003/3/check/gate-project-config-layout/614d542/ : SUCCESS in 10m 58s
- gate-project-config-dib http://logs.openstack.org/03/493003/3/check/gate-project-config-dib/6b8b0c5/ : SUCCESS in 1m 46s'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-09-07 21:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Remove OpenStack/Ceph/Virt repo from CentOS

This patch removes the centos-release-openstack-* RPM installation
from the nodepool image build process. Including this RPM means
that every CI image has four extra yum repositories enabled and none
of those repositories is using the nodepool mirrors by default.

It also creates a CI environment that doesn't match a production
CentOS system. The expectation should be that an individual project
should ensure that the proper repos (and mirrors) are configured
as part of their testing process.

Related-Bug: 1710169
Change-Id: If8ce4ebbf27324e82d6e65c596d8732ac5147d25

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie2fd4435a7b48554a99f701804aa35719b1f97b1

commit_message:
Set proper yum repo priority on CentOS 7

This patch ensures that we get galera from the MariaDB repos
and not from RDO. This matches I2c8e4e64c2425cd36903ae9288bd9fee29eef355
which did the same thing for the galera-server role.

Closes-Bug: #1739472
Change-Id: I8f22083a306ba7569148a53af94397c31d90dbac
(cherry picked from commit 934344ab4121e1a42a47b7946ff789672d5281cd)

commit_message:
Set CloseModalXButton to use button type

CloseModalXButton needs to use button type="button" to prevent submitting
form when clicked

Closes-Bug: 1746517
Change-Id: Ic503bdd898a1732fca8922a7eb9a54be943ee29d

commit_message:
Fix fetchParameters in RoleDetail

FetchParameters action takes redirect function rather than redirectPath,
this causes an error in error handling when  RoleDetail component
fetches parameters

This change updates RoleDetail component to correctly pass redirect
function

Closes-Bug: 1746516
Change-Id: Iaa45ab2617a37d18d2a0c891649c2f6ec9b11177

subject: Update selector used to determine deployment is in progress
messages:
[{'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-01-25 15:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10112, 'date': '2018-01-25 16:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-02-01 14:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think the commit message matches the rest of the patch very well.  While I understand why you'd say that, the code change and its effect are somewhat distant.  The subject should be about the local change, and then the body of the commit message can describe the effects that it has on the deployment steps.

The change itself is fine: a great catch."}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-02-01 15:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Perfect'}, {'account_id': 10112, 'date': '2018-02-01 16:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 15:05:49.000000000', 'message': 'Disable deployment steps with all stack progress states

Change-Id: I55d3fd750be9192c78c1df3e5c49ca704a59503f
'}, {'created': '2018-02-01 15:04:02.000000000', 'message': "Update selector used to determine deployment is in progress

to include all stack '*_IN_PROGRESS' states. This ensures that
DeploymentPlanStep is going to be disabled not just when deployment
is created but also when it is being deleted or scaled up

Change-Id: I55d3fd750be9192c78c1df3e5c49ca704a59503f
"}]
commit_message:
Update selector used to determine deployment is in progress

to include all stack '*_IN_PROGRESS' states. This ensures that
DeploymentPlanStep is going to be disabled not just when deployment
is created but also when it is being deleted or scaled up

Change-Id: I55d3fd750be9192c78c1df3e5c49ca704a59503f

This change removes unnecessary styling from disabled
deployment-step-list list item especially width setting as it causes
horizontal scrollbar to appear

Due to the simplification of group vars [1], we've removed the
definition of cinder_service_region for magnum.

We could put cinder_service_region in all group vars instead,
but it looks like the scoping is done wrong.
We should instead rely on save defaults on the role, that can
be overriden.

Here, we introduce the variable magnum_cinder_service_region,
which defaults to magnum_service_region, i.e. "RegionOne".

We can remove the need for an override that way, and properly
scope variables.

commit_message:
Fix cinder_service_region undefined

Due to the simplification of group vars [1], we've removed the
definition of cinder_service_region for magnum.

We could put cinder_service_region in all group vars instead,
but it looks like the scoping is done wrong.
We should instead rely on save defaults on the role, that can
be overriden.

Here, we introduce the variable magnum_cinder_service_region,
which defaults to magnum_service_region, i.e. "RegionOne".

We can remove the need for an override that way, and properly
scope variables.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504804/18/group_vars/all/cinder.yml

Depends-On: Ia8417bbdac3f515e42d1ed760110a63ae14f8f00

Change-Id: Id25c2d344859adfd09108b759d55f11ae83f97a9
